Additionally, if you or any friendly creatures who can see you regain hit points at the end of a short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains a number of additional hit points equal to the level of the spirit.

subFeatures.name: Release
subFeatures.description: When you release Serenity from your power at the start of your turn (no action required), you are no longer blinded, deafened, frightened, paralysed, poisoned, or stunned.

bound-spirit.name: Sloth
bound-spirit.description: Spirits of Sloth inspire sluggishness and laziness of thought and action around you. While Sloth is bound, the ground within 15 feet of you is difficult terrain for your enemies.

subFeatures.name: Release
subFeatures.description: When you release Sloth as a bonus action, you can slow a number of creatures up to the spirit's level that you can see. A target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save a target is slowed until the end of their next turn, and can take either an action or bonus action on their turn, not both.

bound-spirit.name: Sorrow
bound-spirit.description: The failures of your enemies continue to haunt them in the presence of a spirit of Sorrow. While Sorrow is bound to you, when a creature fails a saving throw against one of your spells of 1st level or higher, it takes psychic damage equal to the spirit's level.

subFeatures.name: Release
subFeatures.description: When Sorrow is released as a bonus action, choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target has disadvantage on the next attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its next turn. If it misses that attack roll or fails the ability check, roll a number of d6s equal to the spirit's level. The target takes psychic damage equal to the total.

bound-spirit.name: Trust
bound-spirit.description: While emboldened by a spirit of trust, you can help your allies through cooperative spellcasting. While Trust is bound, when you finish a long rest you can choose a number of spells from the witch spell list equal to the spirit's level. You and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you of you know these spells, and always have them prepared, and they don't count against the number of spells an affected creature can know or prepare.

subFeatures.name: Release
subFeatures.description: You can release Trust when you take the Help action, as part of that action. When the target makes the attack roll or ability check that you aided, it can reroll one of the dice once.

bound-spirit.name: Valor
bound-spirit.description: Spirits of Valor give those who bind them the power to pull through with confidence against poor odds. While Valor is bound, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

subFeatures.name: Release
subFeatures.description: When you release this spirit as a bonus action, you and a number of creatures equal to the spirit's level that you can see within 30 feet of you are no longer frightened.

bound-spirit.name: Wonder
bound-spirit.description: You radiate an aura of awe when a spirit of Wonder is bound to you. While Wonder is bound, creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive any creature other than you.

subFeatures.name: Release
subFeatures.description: You can release Wonder from your power as an action to inspire awe in a number of creatures equal to the spirit's level that you can see within 30 feet of you. A target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be incapacitated and have a speed of 0 until the end of your next turn.

compound.name: Adrenal Injection
compound.description: For the next minute, your movement speed is increased by 10 feet and your jumping distances are tripled.

compound.name: Allsense Injection
compound.description: For the next minute, you have blindsight out to a distance of 30 feet.

compound.name: Arcane Eye Oil
compound.description: For the next hour, you can sense magic as if you were under the effects of the Detect Magic spell.

compound.name: Draught of Bull's Strength
compound.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws.

compound.name: Draught of Cat's Grace
compound.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Dexterity ability checks and saving throws.

compound.name: Draught of Bear's Endurance
compound.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Constitution ability checks and saving throws.

compound.name: Draught of Fox's Cunning
compound.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws.

compound.name: Draught of Owl's Wisdom
compound.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws.

compound.name: Draught of Eagle's Splendor
compound.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks and saving throws.

compound.name: Elfsight Oil
compound.description: For the next 8 hours, you have darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.

compound.name: Fleshknit Phosphate
compound.description: For the next minute, if you have at least 1 hit point, you heal a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus at the start of each of your turns.

compound.name: Ironmind Injection
compound.description: For the next hour, you have advantage on saving throws made against being charmed or frightened.

compound.name: Liquid Courage
compound.description: You gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution ability score plus twice your level in this class. You lose any remaining temporary hit points from this compound after 1 minute.

compound.name: Liquid Rage
compound.description: For the next minute, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d4 damage.

compound.name: Presto Powder
compound.description: For the next 10 minutes, you have advantage on ability checks made to determine initiative and you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to take the Dash or Disengage action.

compound.name: Spellshine Ointment
compound.description: For the next minute, you have resistance to damage from spells.

compound.name: Steelskin Ointment
compound.description: For the next minute, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

compound.name: Tenmen Tincture
compound.description: For the next hour, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity, and you ignore the heavy property of weapons.

conducting-technique.name: Aria of Suspense
conducting-technique.description: You build an air of tension and paranoia with subtle, droning tones. As an action, you expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. For the next 10 minutes, any creatures of your choice within 60 feet cannot be surprised, and gain a bonus on saving throws against traps and environmental hazards equal to your Bardic Inspiration die roll.

conducting-technique.name: Crash
conducting-technique.description: You learn how to harness and amplify the roar of a well-placed blow into a violent explosion of sound. When a creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you hits with an attack, you can use your reaction to expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. The target of the triggering attack must make a Strength saving throw against your Spell save DC or take thunder damage equal to half of the number you rolled and be knocked prone.

conducting-technique.name: Dirge of Dread
conducting-technique.description:
You play a terrifying dirge to accompany a deathblow, striking fear into the hearts of your nearby enemies. When an ally brings a creature within 60 feet to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. Select a number of creatures within 15 feet of the triggering ally equal to half of the number rolled (minimum 1).

Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become frightened of the triggering ally until the end of that ally's next turn. After the effect ends, or the save is successful, targeted creatures are immune to Dirge of Dread for the next 24 hours.

conducting-technique.name: Dissonance
conducting-technique.description: Summoning a harsh, discordant tone, you muddle the mind of an opponent, lessening their defenses. When a creature within 60 feet is forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. You reduce their saving throw by half of the number rolled. You can use this feature after the creature makes its saving throw roll, but before the DM determines a success or failure.

conducting-technique.name: Guiding Tone
conducting-technique.description: You drag a sharp, powerful chord through the mind of a creature, forcing it to suddenly stumble in a direction you wish. As a bonus action, you expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die and select a creature other than yourself within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell save DC or take psychic damage equal to half of the number rolled and be pushed 10 feet in a direction you choose. A target can fail the saving throw voluntarily.

conducting-technique.name: Hasten Tempo
conducting-technique.description: Your manipulation of tempo and song can inspire others to act more quickly. You can use your bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet. Expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die, adding the number rolled to the creature's initiative and moving them up to the initiative order accordingly. If this would move them higher than you, they immediately take their turn after you finish this round. A creature cannot be affected by Hasten Tempo again until they've finished a short or long rest.

conducting-technique.name: Hymn of Harmony
conducting-technique.description: The melodies surrounding your allies promote rapid recovery. When a creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you regains any hit points, they can expend and roll their inspiration die to regain additional hit points equal to the number rolled.

conducting-technique.name: Majestic Anthem
conducting-technique.description: Pulled from the chaos, you muster an uplifting melody that bolsters the resolve of your allies. You can expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die as an action, and all other creatures you choose within 60 feet gain temporary hit points equal to the number rolled plus your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1). These temporary hit points last until the end of your next turn.

conducting-technique.name: Resonance
conducting-technique.description: You shape the harmonic vibrations of a weapon's movements into a dangerous, sonic enhancement. Using a bonus action, you can expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die, choosing one weapon within 60 feet of you. Until the end of your next turn, all attacks with that weapon deal additional thunder damage equal to half of the number rolled (minimum of 1).

conducting-technique.name: Sprint
conducting-technique.description: The song you conjure can stir the winds, pushing along those who require expedient travel. A creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you can expend and roll their inspiration to increase their speed for that turn. A roll of 1-4 increases their speed of 10 feet, a roll of 5-8 increases their speed by 15 feet, and a roll of 9-12 increases their speed by 20 feet.

color.name: Red - Rage
color.description: The target is struck by sudden anger. For 10 minutes, they add a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die to all Strength ability checks and saving throws.

color.name: Orange - Avarice
color.description: The target feels intense greed towards an item of your choice within 30 feet of you.  For the next minute, the target must use their turn to attempt to acquire the item by any means necessary. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

color.name: Yellow - Fear
color.description: The target is overwhelmed by terror. For 1 minute, the target becomes frightened of you or one creature or object you designate within range that it can see. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

color.name: Green - Will
color.description: The target experiences a moment of willpower. The target may immediately reroll a saving throw to end an effect causing them to be charmed, adding a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die to the roll and for all saving throws against being charmed for the next 10 minutes.

color.name: Blue - Hope
color.description: The target is filled with a surge of hope. The target may immediately reroll a saving throw to end an effect causing them to be frightened, adding a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die to the roll and for all saving throws against being frightened for the next 10 minutes.

color.name: Indigo - Compassion
color.description: The target is enveloped by feelings of compassion. For 1 minute, the target cannot be hostile to other creatures. If the target was hostile before you used this feature, they become indifferent for the duration. This effect ends early if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses its friends being harmed.

color.name: Purple - Love
color.description: The target is overwhelmed by love. For 1 minute, the target becomes charmed by you or one creature or object you designate within range that it can see. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

color.name: Black - Death
color.description: The target's life force begins ebbing away.  For the next minute, the target cannot regain hit points by any means short of the wish spell. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

color.name: White - Life
color.description: The target's connection to this world is solidified.  For the next minute, if the target would be reduced to 0 hit points or killed outright, it can use its reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead.

eldritch-invocation.name: Agonizing Blast
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast your Signature Cantrip, add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage it deals.

eldritch-invocation.name: Armor of Shadows
eldritch-invocation.description: While you are not wearing armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your spellcasting ability modifier.  You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

eldritch-invocation.name: Beast Sense
eldritch-invocation.description: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.

eldritch-invocation.name: Beguiling Influence
eldritch-invocation.description: You gain proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills.

eldritch-invocation.name: Bound to Service
eldritch-invocation.description:
You learn one of the following spells of your choice (which are referred to as summoning spells by other invocations) for which you have its level of pact magic spell slot or mystic arcanum:
  • Summon Aberration
  • Summon Beast
  • Summon Celestial
  • Summon Construct
  • Summon Draconic Spirit
  • Summon Elemental
  • Summon Fey
  • Summon Fiend
  • Summon Shadowspawn
  • Summon Skeleton
You can cast the chosen spell once at its lowest level without expending a spell slot or mystic arcanum, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Additionally, the spell does not require material components when you cast it.

eldritch-invocation.name: Chimeric Essence
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a summoning spell, you can cause the summoned creature to gain the unique traits and attacks of a secondary type in addition to those of the primary type chosen (in conflicts like HP differences, you choose which type to use). For instance, with summon beast, you could summon an air and land beast that would have a walking speed, a climbing speed, a flying speed, flyby, and pack tactics, with a base HP of 30.  The resulting form is unstable and difficult to maintain, reducing the duration of the spell to 1 minute when cast in this way.

eldritch-invocation.name: Devil's Sight
eldritch-invocation.description: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eldritch Empowerment
eldritch-invocation.description:
You can use your action to empower a creature you have summoned through your magical bond with it. When you do so, the creature gains the following benefits until the start of your next turn:
  • The creature's attacks are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical damage.
  • The first time the creature hits with an attack, its target takes an additional 1d10 force damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
  • The creature gains temporary hit points equal to 1 + half your warlock level.
  • You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on summoning spells.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eldritch Mind
eldritch-invocation.description: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eldritch Sight
eldritch-invocation.description:
You can sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

This sense can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eldritch Spear
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast your Signature Cantrip, its range is 300 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eyes of the Rune Keeper
eldritch-invocation.description: You can read all writing.

eldritch-invocation.name: Fiendish Vigor
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast False Life on yourself at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components.

eldritch-invocation.name: Gaze of Two Minds
eldritch-invocation.description: You can use your action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings.

eldritch-invocation.name: Grasp of Hadar
eldritch-invocation.description: Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with your Signature Cantrip, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to yourself.

eldritch-invocation.name: Hand of the Master
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a spell, you can choose to have a creature you have summoned deliver the spell, treating it as the caster for purposes of targeting, range, etc. You must still be able to see the spell's target, unless the target is self. You cannot cast spells that require concentration in this way.

eldritch-invocation.name: Lance of Lethargy
eldritch-invocation.description: Once on each of your turns when you damage a creature with your Signature Cantrip, you can reduce that creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

eldritch-invocation.name: Mask of Many Faces
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Disguise Self at will, without expending a spell slot.

eldritch-invocation.name: Misty Visions
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Silent Image at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

eldritch-invocation.name: Repelling Blast
eldritch-invocation.description: When you damage a creature with your Signature Cantrip, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

eldritch-invocation.name: Shadowed Recall
eldritch-invocation.description: As a bonus action, you can teleport a creature you have summoned to an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you and grant it temporary hit points equal to your warlock level plus your spellcasting ability modifier.  Once you have used this ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Stable Summons
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a summoning spell, its duration is increased to 8 hours. If you use Chimeric Essence, the duration of the spell is 1 hour instead.

eldritch-invocation.name: Thief of Five Fates
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Bane once without using a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Cloak of Flies
eldritch-invocation.description:
As a bonus action, you can surround yourself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura extends 5 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover. It lasts until you're incapacitated or you dismiss it as a bonus action.

The aura grants you advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks but disadvantage on all other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts its turn in the aura takes poison damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 0 damage).

Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Gift of the Depths
eldritch-invocation.description:
You can breathe underwater, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

You can also cast Water Breathing without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Maddening Blast
eldritch-invocation.description: When you damage a creature with your Signature Cantrip, you can use a bonus action to cause other targets of your choice within 5 feet of your target to take damage of the type of your Signature Cantrip equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).

eldritch-invocation.name: Maddening Hex
eldritch-invocation.description: As a bonus action, you cause a psychic disturbance around the target cursed by your Hex spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse and Sign of Ill Omen. When you do so, you deal psychic damage to the cursed target and each creature of your choice within 5 feet of it. The psychic damage equals your spellcasting abiltiy modifier (minimum of 1 damage). To use this invocation, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

eldritch-invocation.name: Mire the Mind
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Slow once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Occult Strikes
eldritch-invocation.description: When you use your action to cast your Signature Cantrip, you can forgo one of the attack rolls or saving throws to make a single melee weapon attack as part of the action. In addition, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

eldritch-invocation.name: One With Shadows
eldritch-invocation.description: When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become invisible until you move or take an action or a reaction.

eldritch-invocation.name: Protector's Embrace
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Warding Bond without expending a spell slot targeting a creature you have summoned. When cast in this way, the spell does not require material components and has unlimited range. For the duration of the spell, if you or the summoned creature regains lost hit points via magical healing, the other regains the same number of hit points unless it was targeted by the same effect.  Once you have cast the spell in this way, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Sign of Ill Omen
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Bestow Curse once without using a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Tomb of Levistus
eldritch-invocation.description: As a reaction when you take damage, you can entomb yourself in ice, which melts away at the end of your next turn. You gain 10 temporary hit points per warlock level, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. Immediately after you take the damage, you gain vulnerability to fire damage, your speed is reduced to 0, and you are incapacitated. These effects, including any remaining temporary hit points, all end when the ice melts.  Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Undying Servitude
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Animate Dead without using a spell slot. Once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Astral Bond
eldritch-invocation.description:
You can communicate telepathically with a creature you have summoned, and perceive through its senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence.

Additionally, as a bonus action, you can exchange physical positions with your summoned creature as long as you are on the same plane of existence. Once you have used this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Dreadful Word
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Confusion once without using a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ethereal Sight
eldritch-invocation.description: As an action, you can enhance your vision with the ethereal energy of undeath, allowing you to see through solid objects within 30 feet. For 1 minute, you have darkvision if you did not already, and you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent shadows of themselves. You must concentrate on this sense as if you were concentrating on a spell.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ghostly Gaze
eldritch-invocation.description: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have darkvision if you don't already have it. This special sight lasts for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images.  Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Otherworldly Nature
eldritch-invocation.description: Your very being is suffused with eldritch magic. You no longer need to eat, breathe, or sleep. Though, to gain the benefits of a long rest, you must spend 8 hours doing light activity. Also, for every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

eldritch-invocation.name: Relentless Hex
eldritch-invocation.description: Your curse creates a temporary bond between you and your target. As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target cursed by your Hex spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse and Sign of Ill Omen. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the cursed target.

eldritch-invocation.name: Sculptor of Flesh
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Polymorph once without using a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Trickster's Escape
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Freedom of Movement once on yourself without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ascendant Step
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Levitate on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

eldritch-invocation.name: Otherworldly Pay
eldritch-invocation.description: Your jump distance is tripled

eldritch-invocation.name: Whispers of the Grave
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Speak With Dead at will, without expending a spell slot.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eldritch Incarnation
eldritch-invocation.description: When you summon a creature with a summoning spell, you can choose to make it your eldritch incarnation. If you do so, the summoned incarnation is permanent until dispelled or killed, and you do not need to maintain concentration on the spell. You can dismiss the incarnation as a bonus action. You cannot create another incarnation while one is still active. Incarnations cannot be affected by Chimeric Essence, and if you die, so does your incarnation. If you lose this invocation, your eldritch incarnation immediately dies.  If your incarnation is killed, dispelled, or dismissed, you cannot make another until 1d4+1 days have passed.

eldritch-invocation.name: Master of Myriad Forms
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Alter Self at will, without expending a spell slot.

eldritch-invocation.name: Shroud of Shadow
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Invisibility at will, without expending a spell slot.

eldritch-invocation.name: Visions of Distant Realms
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Arcane Eye at will, without expending a spell slot.

eldritch-invocation.name: Witch Sight
eldritch-invocation.description: You can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30 feet of you and within line of sight.

eldritch-invocation.name: Shadow Knight
eldritch-invocation.description: If your pact armor imposes a penalty to Dexterity (Stealth) checks, it no longer does so.

eldritch-invocation.name: Suit Up
eldritch-invocation.description: When you roll initiative, if you are not wearing your pact armor, you may immediately summon your pact armor.

eldritch-invocation.name: Frozen Armor
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast the Armor of Agathys spell at 1st level at will, without expending a spell slot.   In addition, your pact armor gains immunity to the Heat Metal spell.

eldritch-invocation.name: Improved Pact Armor
eldritch-invocation.description: You can now choose to summon plate armor when you summon your pact armor.

eldritch-invocation.name: Superior Pact Armor
eldritch-invocation.description: You can now choose to summon heavy plate armor when you summon your pact armor.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ultimate Pact Armor
eldritch-invocation.description: You can now choose to summon fortress plate armor when you summon your pact armor.

eldritch-invocation.name: Improved Pact Weapon
eldritch-invocation.description: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.  In addition, the weapon gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to those rolls.  Finally, the weapon you conjure can be a simple or martial ranged weapon.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eldritch Smite
eldritch-invocation.description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal an extra 1d8 force damage to the target, plus another 1d8 per level of the spell slot, and you can knock the target prone if it is Huge or smaller.

eldritch-invocation.name: Thirsting Blade
eldritch-invocation.description:
You can attack with your pact weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Moreover, you can choose for the attacks with your pact weapon to deal the same damage type as your Signature Cantrip.

eldritch-invocation.name: Occult Smite
eldritch-invocation.description:
Once per turn when you hit with an attack with a pact weapon, you deal bonus damage to the target as if it had been hit, or failed its saving throw against one manifestation of your Signature Cantrip.

If your Signature Cantrip imposes extra effects, such as the reduced speed of Lance of Lethargy, it suffers those as well.

eldritch-invocation.name: Superior Pact Weapon
eldritch-invocation.description: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.  In addition, the weapon counts as a magic weapon with a +2 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, unless it is already a magic weapon that you transformed into your pact weapon.

eldritch-invocation.name: Lifedrinker
eldritch-invocation.description: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes extra necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum 1).

eldritch-invocation.name: Ultimate Pact Weapon
eldritch-invocation.description: You can use any weapon you summon with your Pact of the Blade feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.  In addition, the weapon counts as a magic weapon with a +3 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, unless it is already a magic weapon that you transformed into your pact weapon.

eldritch-invocation.name: Deadeye
eldritch-invocation.description: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature or attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls with a firearm. Additionally you can use your pact firearm as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

eldritch-invocation.name: Dual Dirge
eldritch-invocation.description: Whenever you create your pact firearm in the form of a pistol, you can choose to create a second loaded pistol in your other hand. Additionally when you use the Attack action and attack with a one-handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a pistol you are holding.

eldritch-invocation.name: Eagle Eye
eldritch-invocation.description: While you are wielding a firearm its long and short attack range are both doubled.

eldritch-invocation.name: Improved Pact Firearm
eldritch-invocation.description: Your pact firearm gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, unless it is a magic firearm that already has a bonus to those rolls.

eldritch-invocation.name: Quickdraw
eldritch-invocation.description: Immediately after initiative is rolled, you can use your reaction to summon your pact firearm and make one attack with it against a creature within range.

eldritch-invocation.name: Aggressive Fire
eldritch-invocation.description: You can attack with your pact firearm twice, instead of once whenever you take the attack action on your turn.

eldritch-invocation.name: Death's List
eldritch-invocation.description: Immediately after initiative is rolled, you can spend a warlock spell slot to choose a number of creatures that you can see up to your Charisma modifier to mark them. You gain a death die, a d4 which you can add to your damage rolls with your pact firearm against a marked creature for 1 minute or until you hit a nonmarked creature. Whenever you reduce a marked creature to 0 hit points your death die increases to a d6, if your death die is already a d6 it instead increases to a d8, if your death die is already a d8 it instead increases to a d10. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Superior Pact Firearm
eldritch-invocation.description: Your pact firearm gains a +2 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, unless it is a magic firearm that already has a bonus to those rolls.

eldritch-invocation.name: Bullet Time
eldritch-invocation.description: Immediately after initiative is rolled, you can spend a warlock spell slot and use your reaction to caste Haste on yourself. Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ultimate Pact Firearm
eldritch-invocation.description: Your pact firearm gains a +3 bonus to its attack and damage rolls, unless it is a magic firearm that already has a bonus to those rolls.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ace Thrower
eldritch-invocation.description:
When you throw your playing cards, you can throw them with a range of 120/240 ft.

In addition, when you make an attack with your playing cards, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier, rather than Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

eldritch-invocation.name: Gambit
eldritch-invocation.description: Choose a suit to be your signature from clubs, diamonds, hearts, or spades.  Your playing cards gain an additional effect based on your choice.  When you finish a long rest, you can change your signature suit.  You can use the effect of your signature suit a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Clubs
traits.description: When you damage a creature with your playing cards, you can also knock them prone.

traits.name: Diamonds
traits.description: As a reaction when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can throw a playing card at them to grant them a bonus to their roll equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

traits.name: Hearts
traits.description: As an action, you can throw a playing card at a creature within 60 feet of you, granting them temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

traits.name: Spades
traits.description: As a bonus action, you can throw a playing card to a point within 30 feet of you, instantly teleporting to the spot the card lands.

eldritch-invocation.name: Improved Pact Cards
eldritch-invocation.description: When you use an action to make an attack with your playing cards, you can make two attacks with your playing cards as a part of the same action.

eldritch-invocation.name: Jack of Diamonds
eldritch-invocation.description:
Add House of Cards as one of the effects you can perform when you spray your playing cards in a cone.

House of Cards. Along the far edge of the cone you create a wall of spectral cards 10 feet high, which lasts for 1 minute or until it is destroyed. The wall has a number of hit points equal to twice your Warlock level and an Armor Class equal to 10 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

In addition, the cone's range increases by 5 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: King of Clubs
eldritch-invocation.description:
Add Pushing Cards as one of the effects you can perform when you spray your playing cards in a cone.

Pushing Cards. All creatures in the cone must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes force damage equal to half your Warlock level and is pushed 15 feet away from you, taking half as much damage and not being pushed on a successful saving throw. In addition, the area within the cone becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute.

In addition, the cone's range increases by 5 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: Queen of Hearts
eldritch-invocation.description:
Add Burning Cards as one of the effects you can perform when you spray your playing cards in a cone.

Burning Cards. All creatures in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking fire damage equal to half your Warlock level and being set alight for 1 minute on a failed saving throw, taking half as much damage and not being set alight on a successful saving throw. A burning creature takes fire damage equal to half your Warlock level at the start of each of their turns. A creature can use an action to put out themselves or a willing creature within 5 feet of them.

In addition, the cone's range increases by 5 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: Joker's Luck
eldritch-invocation.description:
Add Rigged Cards as one of the effects you can perform when you spray your playing cards in a cone.

Rigged Cards. All creatures in the cone must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed saving throw, their luck becomes rigged for 1 minute. While their luck is rigged, they must roll all damage dice twice, and take the lower result.

In addition, the cone's range increases by 5 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ace of Spades
eldritch-invocation.description:
Add Trump Card as one of the effects you can perform when you spray your playing cards in a cone.

Trump Card. One creature of your choice within the cone must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed saving throw, the target takes force damage equal to twice your Warlock level and is paralyzed for 1 minute, taking half as much damage and not being paralyzed on a successful save. A paralyzed creature can repeat their saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a successful saving throw.

In addition, the cone's range increases by 5 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: Superior Pact Cards
eldritch-invocation.description: When you use an action to make an attack with your playing cards, you can make three attacks with your playing cards as a part of the same action.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ultimate Pact Cards
eldritch-invocation.description: When you use an action to make an attack with your playing cards, you can make four attacks with your playing cards as a part of the same action.

eldritch-invocation.name: Mirror of Fates
eldritch-invocation.description: You can peer into the uncertain future. Using your Pact Chalice as a spellcasting focus, you can cast Augury at-will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

eldritch-invocation.name: Cup of Recovery
eldritch-invocation.description: Using your pact chalice as a spellcasting focus, you can use an action to cast Lesser Restoration without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Cup of Protection
eldritch-invocation.description: Using your pact chalice as a spellcasting focus, you can use an action to cast Death Ward without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Alchemical Restoration
eldritch-invocation.description: As an action on your turn, you can cast Reincarnate without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you cast Reincarnate in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can cast the spell in this way again.

eldritch-invocation.name: Gift of the Ever-Living Ones
eldritch-invocation.description: Whenever you regain hit points while your familiar is within 100 feet of you, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.

eldritch-invocation.name: Investment of the Chain Master
eldritch-invocation.description:
When you cast Find Familiar, you infuse the summoned familiar with a measure of your eldritch power, granting the creature the following benefits:
  • The familiar gains either a flying speed or a swimming speed (your choice) of 40 feet.
  • As a bonus action, you can command the familiar to take the Attack action.
  • The familiar's weapon attacks are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks.
  • If the familiar forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC.
  • When the familiar takes damage, you can use your reaction to grant it resistance against that damage.

eldritch-invocation.name: Voice of the Chain Master
eldritch-invocation.description: You can communicate telepathically with your familiar and perceive through your familiar's senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence. Additionally, while perceiving through your familiar's senses, you can also speak through your familiar in your own voice, even if your familiar is normally incapable of speech.

eldritch-invocation.name: Chains of Carceri
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Hold Monster at will without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

eldritch-invocation.name: Iron Grip
eldritch-invocation.description: While you have your claws manifested, you gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including scaling walls and upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

eldritch-invocation.name: Spilled Vitality
eldritch-invocation.description: You've learned to draw on your own vitality to empower your magic. You can cast a warlock spell you know without expending a spell slot by instead expending a number of your Hit Dice equal to the spell's level.

eldritch-invocation.name: Thirsting Claws
eldritch-invocation.description: You can attack with your claws twice, instead of once, each time you take the Attack action on your turn. Your claw attacks also count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical damage.

eldritch-invocation.name: Cursed Flesh
eldritch-invocation.description: As a bonus action, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).

eldritch-invocation.name: Eldritch Flight
eldritch-invocation.description: As a bonus action, you can manifest (or dismiss) wings reminiscent of your Patron's physical form, granting you a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

eldritch-invocation.name: Knowledge of Antiquity
eldritch-invocation.description: When you make an Intelligence (History) check related to an event, in the place where that event took place, you see echos of the past and treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

eldritch-invocation.name: Time Dialation
eldritch-invocation.description: Once per long rest, you can cast Haste, at a level equal to your Pact Magic spell slots, without expending a spell slot.

eldritch-invocation.name: Temporal Rewind
eldritch-invocation.description: As a reaction when you finish your turn, you can undo everything that happened on your turn. You return to the space you began that turn in and you regain all resources you expended. You can then immediately repeat your turn. Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ancient Rune
eldritch-invocation.description:
The damage dealt by your Runestone's attack becomes 2d8.

As you gain Warlock levels the damage continues to increase: becoming 3d8 at 11th level and 4d8 at 17th level.

eldritch-invocation.name: Elder Rune of Abjuration
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Counterspell once at a level equal to your Pact Magic spell slots, without expending a spell slot.  You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Elder Rune of Immovability
eldritch-invocation.description: As an action, you can active the rune, which causes your Runestone to become magically fixed in place.  Until you use a bonus action to recall the Runestone to your hand, it doesn't move.  Your Runestone can hold up to 8000 pounds of weight.  More weight causes the rune to dispel and fall.  As an action, a creature can make a Strength check (DC = 10 + your Warlock spell save DC).  On a success, they can move the Runestone up to 10 feet.

eldritch-invocation.name: Elder Rune of Protection
eldritch-invocation.description: While your Runestone is in your hand, you gain a bonus to your saving throws equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of +1).

eldritch-invocation.name: Bestow Magic
eldritch-invocation.description: As an action while holding your pact scepter, you can expend a spell slot to grant a willing creature you touch the ability to cast a spell you know once, at the level of the spell slot expended, using your spellcasting ability.  You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Improved Pact Scepter
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a spell using your pact scepter as your spellcasting focus, you gain a +1 bonus to your spell attack modifier and your spell save DC.

eldritch-invocation.name: Superior Pact Scepter
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a spell using your pact scepter as your spellcasting focus, you gain a +2 bonus to your spell attack modifier and your spell save DC.

eldritch-invocation.name: Overcharge
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a spell using your pact scepter as your spellcasting focus, you can expend all of the scepter's uses to cast it as though you had cast the spell using a 9th-level spell slot.

eldritch-invocation.name: Ultimate Pact Scepter
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a spell using your pact scepter as your spellcasting focus, you gain a +3 bonus to your spell attack modifier and your spell save DC.

eldritch-invocation.name: Protective Cowl
eldritch-invocation.description: When you take damage while wearing your Pact Shroud, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to the damage from that attack, but your Pact Shroud disappears, and you must finish a short or long rest before you can summon it again.

eldritch-invocation.name: Cloak of Winds
eldritch-invocation.description: Your pact shroud billows out around you, slowing your fall and allowing you to glide. When you fall, you can subtract up to 100 feet from your fall when calculating your fall damage and can move horizontally 2 feet for every 1 foot you fall.

eldritch-invocation.name: Improved Shroud
eldritch-invocation.description: While wearing your Pact Shroud while in darkness or shadows, you are considered invisible to any creature that relies on darkvision or devil's sight to see in that darkness.

eldritch-invocation.name: Cloak of Twilight
eldritch-invocation.description: You learn the Greater Invisibility spell, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known, and you can cast Greater Invisibility once without expending spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Breakneck Speed
eldritch-invocation.description: You can cast Longstrider at will, without expending a spell slot or material components, but only targeting yourself or your pact steed.

eldritch-invocation.name: Trampling Charge
eldritch-invocation.description: Your pact steed gains the ability to attack while you are mounted.

eldritch-invocation.name: Empowered Steed
eldritch-invocation.description: You learn the Find Greater Steed spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.  When the spell is cast in this way, the steed summoned replaces your existing pact steed and is considered your pact steed.

eldritch-invocation.name: Harmonic Spellcasting
eldritch-invocation.description: When you cast a warlock spell with a verbal component while using your pact instrument as your spellcasting focus, the saving throw DC for that spell increases by 1.

eldritch-invocation.name: Enchanting Melody
eldritch-invocation.description: You learn the charm monster spell, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known, and you can cast charm monster once without expending spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Rebuke of the Talisman
eldritch-invocation.description: When the wearer of your talisman is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to deal psychic damage to the attacker equal to your proficiency bonus and push it up to 10 feet away from the talisman's wearer.

eldritch-invocation.name: Protection of the Talisman
eldritch-invocation.description: When the wearer of your talisman fails a saving throw, they can add a d4 to the roll, potentially turning the save into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Bond of the Talisman
eldritch-invocation.description: While someone else is wearing your talisman, you can use your action to teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The wearer of your talisman can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you. The teleportation can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

eldritch-invocation.name: Aspect of the Moon
eldritch-invocation.description: You no longer need to sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. To gain the benefits of a long rest, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity, such as reading your Book of Shadows and keeping watch.

eldritch-invocation.name: Book of Ancient Secrets
eldritch-invocation.description:
Your Eldritch Tome gains two new pages, each detailing one 1st-level ritual spell of your choice from any class spell list. These spells count as Warlock spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

You can also mystically add additional ritual spells to your Eldritch Tome, so long as the ritual spell is equal to the level of your Pact Magic spell slots or lower. To do so, you perform a 1-hour ritual during which you burn one scroll detailing the ritual spell and 50 gp worth of incense per level of the spell. After which, a page detailing the spell appears in your Tome.

eldritch-invocation.name: Blasphemous Prayer
eldritch-invocation.description:
You learn one Channel Divinity option of your choice from the options available to Clerics or Paladins, and add it to a page in your Tome.

Once you use this Channel Divinity you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

traits.description:
As an action, you present your Book of Shadows and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

You can use your Channel Divinity to abjure otherworldly creatures. As an action, you present your Book of Shadows, and one celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend of your choice that is within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw, provided that the creature can see or hear you. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly end its move in a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can only use the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

You can use your action to change the physical appearance and self-image of a creature you see within 30 feet of you, revealing its true grace or exposing its ugliness for 10 minutes. Choose one of the following effects:
  • The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become insecure and have its body and visage slightly twisted and deformed, gaining disadvantage on Dexterity and Charisma ability checks for the duration.
  • The creature is filled with confidence and it becomes lovelier and more elegant, gaining advantage on Dexterity and Charisma ability checks for the duration.

You can use Channel Divinity to destroy another creature's life force by touch. When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can use Channel Divinity to deal extra necrotic damage to the target. The damage equals 5 + twice your warlock level.

You can use your Channel Divinity to speak a prophecy, inducing visions and hallucinations in nearby creatures.

As an action, choose a point within 120 feet of you that you can see and roll on the Eldritch Effects table. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the chosen point must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer the temporary effect for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can make another Wisdom saving throw, ending the temporary effect on a success.

subFeatures.name: Eldritch Effects
subFeatures.description:
d8 Effect
1 The creature cannot speak or cast spells that have verbal components.
2 The creature takes 1d8 psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.
3 The creature is disoriented. It immediately falls prone and falls prone again at the end of each turn it moves 5 feet or more.
4 The creature is distracted by visions and voices and has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) ability checks.
5 The creature is unsure of itself. It can move or take an action on its turn but not both and it cannot use reactions.
6 The creature is reckless. It has advantage on attack rolls and attack rolls against it have advantage.
7 The creature is deafened and cannot see objects or creatures further than 30 feet away.
8 The creature is frightened of you.

traits.description:
You can use your Channel Divinity to create simple items. You conduct an hour-long ritual that crafts a nonmagical item that must include some metal: a simple or martial weapon, a suit of armor, ten pieces of ammunition, a set of tools, or another metal object. The creation is completed at the end of the hour, coalescing in an unoccupied space of your choice on a surface within 5 feet of you.

The thing you create can be something that is worth no more than 100 gp. As part of this ritual, you must lay out metal, which can include coins, with a value equal to the creation. The metal irretrievably coalesces and transforms into the creation at the ritual's end, magically forming even nonmetal parts of the creation.

The ritual can create a duplicate of a nonmagical item that contains metal, such as a key, if you possess the original during the ritual.

You can use your Channel Divinity to mark another creature's life force for termination.  As an action, you choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you, cursing it until the end of your next turn. The next time you or an ally of yours hits the cursed creature with an attack, the creature has vulnerability to all of that attack's damage, and then the curse ends.

You can use your Channel Divinity to inspire an ally with resolve and hope.  As an action, you can present your Book of Shadows and select a creature you can see within 60 feet. Until the end of your next turn, the target makes all attack rolls and saving throws with advantage.

You can use your Channel Divinity to bestow a temporary resilience to arcane harm. As a bonus action, you present your Book of Shadows and choose a creature you can see (including yourself) within 30 feet. The chosen creature gains temporary hit points equal to 1d10 + your warlock level. While a creature has temporary hit points granted by your spell shield, it has resistance to damage from spells and advantage on saving throws against spells. The creature loses any remaining temporary hit points after 1 hour.

You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke judgement upon your enemies. As an action, you present your Book of Shadows, causing a creature you can see within 60 feet of you to be crushed beneath the weight of their sins. For 1 minute, you can apply the bonus damage of Sacred Judgement to that creature when dealing damage with a Divine spell.

The chosen creature must also make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone and their movement speed becomes 0 for 1 minute. The creature can repeat their saving throw at the end of each of their turns. If the creature has dealt damage since the start of their turn, they make this save at disadvantage.
You can use your Channel Divinity to tap into a divine well of knowledge. As an action, you choose one skill or tool. For 10 minutes, you have proficiency with the chosen skill or tool.

You can use your Channel Divinity to heal the badly injured.  As an action, you present your Book of Shadows and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your warlock level. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct.

You can use your Channel Divinity to harness sunlight, banishing darkness and dealing radiant damage to your foes.  As an action, you present your Book of Shadows, and any magical darkness within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to 2d10 + your warlock level on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.

You can use your Channel Divinity to inspire an ally with resolve and hope. As an action, you can present your Book of Shadows and select a creature you can see within 60 feet. Until the end of your next turn, the target makes all attack rolls and saving throws with advantage.

You can use your Channel Divinity as an action to present your Book of Shadows and open up a rift in space. Choose a point centered on an unoccupied 10-foot cube within 60 feet of you. The rift appears as a 5-foot radius sphere of blackness with long, lashing tendrils.

Choose a number of creatures you can see up to your Intelligence modifier within 30 feet of the sphere. Each target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled 20 feet toward the sphere. A creature that is pulled into the sphere's space takes psychic damage equal to 2d8 + your warlock level. The rift then closes.

You can use your Channel Divinity to unleash a breath attack.  As an action, you bring your Book of Shadows to your lips and summon the wrath of a dragon, and let loose a breath weapon whose area and damage type are described in the color of dragon you chose. Each creature your breath weapon hits must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell DC. On a failed save they take 3d6 damage of the chosen color or half as much on a successful save.

traits.name: Draconic Representation
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is fire and your breath weapon manifests in a 15-foot cone.

traits.name: Draconic Ideals
traits.description: Your draconic ideals are converstaion and negotiation.

traits.name: Draconic Representation
traits.description: Your draconic damage type is lightning and your breath weapon manifests in a 30-foot line.

traits.name: Draconic Ideals
traits.description: Your draconic ideals are courage and valor.
