expressive-mantra.name: Sixth Quick Wit
expressive-mantra.description:
You focus field's speed increases by 10 feet.

You can learn this mantra multiple times, up to a total number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

expressive-mantra.name: Rebounding Axiom
expressive-mantra.description: When you make a high or a long jump from within 5 feet of your focus field, you can spend 1 ki point using your reaction to roll your Psi Die and extend the distance of the jump, up to a number of feet equal to five times the number rolled. Regardless of how long the jump is, the extra distance costs you only 5 feet of movement.

expressive-mantra.name: Soothing Meditation
expressive-mantra.description:
During a short rest, you can calm the minds of yourself and your allies to bring an extra sense of peace and replenishment to their respite. You can reduce your Psi Die by one size and choose a friendly creature within the maximum range of your focus field. Any Hit Dice the chosen creature within the maximum range of your focus field. Any Hit Dice the chosen creature spends during this short rest count as one die size higher than normal, up to a maximum size of a d20.

You can affect multiple creatures with this mantra in one short rest, reducing your Psi Die by a further die size for each creature you affect, until it becomes a d2.

expressive-mantra.name: Sting of Doubt
expressive-mantra.description: When a creature up to one size larger than your focus field within 10 feet of it makes an attack, you can spend 1 ki point using your reaction to immediately move the field to the creature and tighten the field. The creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is restrained until the start of its next turn.

expressive-mantra.name: The Shape of Things
expressive-mantra.description: Your focus field assists you in sensing the contours of what it surrounds. You have advantage on Investigation and Perception checks on creatures or objects within 5 feet of the field.

expressive-mantra.name: Trace the Waves
expressive-mantra.description: You can spend 2 ki points as a bonus action to add your Psionic ability modifier to Insight, Deception, or Persuasion checks you make against creatures within 5 feet of your focus field for 1 minute.

expressive-mantra.name: Turning of the Blade
expressive-mantra.description:
When a melee attack must pass within 5 feet of your focus field, you can spend up to 4 ki points using your reaction to telekinetically defend the target of the attack. The target gains a bonus to its Armor Class equal to 1 + the number of ki points spent, possibly causing the triggering attack to miss. The bonus lasts until the start of your next turn, or until the target moves more than 5 feet away from the focus field's space.

If this reaction causes the triggering attack to miss, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt to knock the weapon from the attacker's hands as part of the same reaction. The attacking creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed saving throw, it drops the weapon used to make the triggering attack, if it is capable of doing so. The weapon lands at its feet.

expressive-mantra.name: Unfurling Impulse
expressive-mantra.description: As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to push outwards from your focus field with a bloom of telekinetic force. All creatures other than you within 5 feet of the field must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be shunted away from it in a direction of your choice. A creature can choose to willingly fail this save. The total force of your push is equal to 10 times your proficiency bonus, which you divide among creatures that failed their saving throws as you see fit. Each creature is pushed the number of feet you allocate to it (minimum of 5 feet).

expressive-mantra.name: Web of the Silent Spider
expressive-mantra.description:
As a bonus action, you can spend 1 ki point to entrap a creature within 5 feet of your focus field in a zone of psychic silence for 1 minute. All communication made by the target fails to travel more than 5 feet from it. You know whenever the target attempts to communicate, and you can spend 1 further ki point to overhear the words telepathically.

This effect ends early if your focus field moves more than 5 feet from the entrapped creature.

expressive-mantra.name: Astral Entwinement
expressive-mantra.description: As an action, you can pass a Tiny object weighing up to your Psionic ability score in pounds to a conscious creature you can speak with using your telepathic link, as if beside it.

expressive-mantra.name: Tap Psyche
expressive-mantra.description:
When you roll your Psi Die to deal damage to a target, you can spend ki points to draw on the mental strength of other minds bonded by yours to empower your strike. Roll an additional number of Psi Dice up to the number of creatures you can currently speak with through your telepathic link, spending 1 ki point for every two creatures tapped (minimum of 1 ki point), and add the result to the damage dealt. Use the first die rolled to determine whether the size of your Psi Die changes after the triggering action is resoled.

Once you use this mantra, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

expressive-mantra.name: Unkint Trauma
expressive-mantra.description: As a bonus action, you can spend 1 ki point to target a creature you are telepathically linked with that is frightened, suffering short-term madness, or that has taken psychic damage since the start of its last turn. Roll your Psi Die. The target regains hit points equal to the number rolled, and any of the specified conditions affecting it immediately end.

expressive-mantra.name: Argent Chains
expressive-mantra.description: As an action, you can spend 2 ki points to extend your preternatural power through the links that connect you to other creatures. For 1 minute, the attacks of creatures that form part of your telepathic link count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

expressive-mantra.name: Calm Within Chaos
expressive-mantra.description: When a creature within 5 feet of your focus field is forced to make a saving throw to maintain concentration, you can spend 2 ki points as a reaction and roll your Psi Die. The creature adds the number rolled to its saving throw.

expressive-mantra.name: Focused Outburst
expressive-mantra.description: Once per turn before you roll your Psi Die to deal damage, you can concentrate and compress your psychic power to reduce the die's size by one. You must make this choice before you roll the die. If you then roll the highest number on the die, it increases by one die size after the roll as normal, and you can immediately rol it again, adding the result to the damage dealt. If you again roll the highest number on the die, the effect repeats, up until the die can no longer increase in size.

expressive-mantra.name: Halt Ire
expressive-mantra.description:
When a ranged weapon attack passes within 5 feet of your focus field, you can spend 1 ki point using your reaction to deflect or catch the missile as it does so. The damage the target takes from the attack is reduced by one roll of your Psi Die + your Psionic ability modifier + your mystic level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can seize the missile in your focus field. If you do so, you can spend 1 further ki point to make a ranged attack with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught as part of the same reaction. You make this attack with proficiency, and it uses the same damage dice as the original attack. Use your Psionic ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls of the attack, which has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

expressive-mantra.name: Ponderous Weight of Failure
expressive-mantra.description: When a creature within 5 feet of you focus field succeeds on a saving throw, you can spend 2 ki points using your reaction to squeeze the field and attempt to disrupt its focus. The creature must reroll the saving throw against your Psionic save DC. On a failure, the creature is also considered to have failed the saving throw against the triggering effect.

expressive-mantra.name: Vital Balance
expressive-mantra.description:
You can spend 3 ki points as an action to lend your own alacrity in body and mind to another, casting the Haste spell on a creature within 5 feet of your focus field. When you cast the spell in this way, it does not require concentration, though you can choose to end it at any time. You are under the effects of the Slow spell while a target benefits from your speed.

If you cast the spell in this way on another creature, the spell immediately ends on its original target.

expressive-mantra.name: Wax and Wane
expressive-mantra.description:
As a bonus action, you can spend 2 ki points to reach into your reserves of psychic strength and increase your Psi Die size by one step for 1 minute. Your Psi Die can increase beyond its starting size when empowered in this way, up to a maximum size of 1d12. When the effect ends, your Psi Die reverts to one die size smaller than it was before you use this feature.

Additionally, while your Psi Die is larger than a d2, you can expend a use of your Reorient Thoughts feature to immediately regain 1 ki point.

expressive-mantra.name: Whatever Lingers On
expressive-mantra.description:
As an action, you can spend 3 ki points to cast the Speak With Dead spell. When you cast the spell in this way, each creature that you can currently speak with through your telepathic link can also ask one additional question of the target.

While the spell persists, any creature able to ask a question of the target can instead choose to ask its question to a creature it previously had a telepathic link with that has since died. The creature's spirit answers as if contacted via the spell.

expressive-mantra.name: Dissever from Violence
expressive-mantra.description: As a reaction when a hostile creature no more than one size larger than your focus field moves within 5 feet of you and you are within 5 feet of the field, you can spend 1 ki point to flare the field and push yourself and the intruding creature apart. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet horizontally backwards. Whether the creature succeeds or fails its saving throw, you are pushed up to 15 feet horizontally backwards away from it.

expressive-mantra.name: Ebbing Resolve
expressive-mantra.description: When you reduce a creature's damage dice using your Dull Thoughts feature, you can spend ki points to reduce the size of the dice for the duration by a further stage for each ki point spent, down to a minimum size of a d2.

expressive-mantra.name: Likeminds
expressive-mantra.description: When you cast a spell through a mystic feature, it can be delivered from the space of any creature you can currently speak with via your telepathic link.

expressive-mantra.name: Scales of the Will
expressive-mantra.description:
When you use your Sentient Sense feature, you can spend 1 additional ki point to weigh the mental strength of creatures you detect against your own. The DM tells you if the creatures are your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:
  • Intelligence score
  • Wisdom score
  • Charisma score
  • Total skill proficiencies known
  • Total class levels (if any)
  • Total mystic levels (if any)
You can choose to weigh more than two characteristics, spending an additional ki point for each characteristic per creature you wish to weigh yourself against.

expressive-mantra.name: Titanic Will
expressive-mantra.description: Your focus field increases in size to become Large. This doubles the field's carrying capacity and the amount it can push, drag, and lift.

expressive-mantra.name: Blossoming Ennui
expressive-mantra.description: Whenever you use your Dull Thoughts feature, you can spend 2 ki points and choose an additional number of creature up to your Intelligence modifier within 60 feet of you to have their willpower diminished, along with the original target.

expressive-mantra.name: Force of Will
expressive-mantra.description: Psychic damage you deal ignores resistance to psychic damage. In addition, when you roll psychic damage, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.

expressive-mantra.name: Sage of the Psychic
expressive-mantra.description: As a bonus action when your focus field is within 5 feet of you, you can spend 2 ki points to gain proficiency in your choice of Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throws while the field remains within that range. While you have this benefit, you can spend 1 further ki point as a bonus action to change which of these saving throws you have proficiency in.

expressive-mantra.name: Second Thought
expressive-mantra.description: When you use a ki point to take a reaction, you can immediately spend 1 further ki point to regain your reaction. You cannot do so again until the start of your next turn.

expressive-mantra.name: Superiority Complex
expressive-mantra.description: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. When flying in this way, you cannot move further than the maximum range of your focus field away from a solid surface.

expressive-mantra.name: Blade Through the Veil
expressive-mantra.description: You can spend 7 ki points as an action to grant your focus field truesight within 30 feet of its space for 10 minutes. When the effect expires, you can immediately spend 1 further ki point to extend the duration for a further 10 minutes.

expressive-mantra.name: Meeting of the Paths
expressive-mantra.description:
As an action, you can spend 6 ki points to swap minds with a willing creature within 5 feet of your focus field. Each of your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the other creature, but you each retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You each also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the other creature that use its Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution scores. You each assume the hit points and Hit Dice of the other creature. You retain the benefit of any features from the your class and you can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so.

The effect lasts for 1 hour or until either creature is knocked unconscious, unless you choose to end it early as a bonus action. If your body is outside of the maximum range of your focus field when the effect ends, both you and the creature you swapped minds with are stunned for 1 minute as your minds traverse the distance to find their usual bodies.

expressive-mantra.name: Persona Major
expressive-mantra.description: When a creature fails a saving throw against an effect delivered through your focus field that you expended ki to create and is within 5 feet of the field, you can spend 2 further ki points to impress your dominance upon the creature's mind. The target becomes paralyzed for 1 minute, beginning after the triggering effect has taken place. The creature can make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

expressive-mantra.name: Raveling Memory
expressive-mantra.description: As an action, you can spend 5 ki points to psychically harmonize with one object of size Large or smaller that is within 5 feet of your focus field. You must concentrate on this effect as though concentrating on a spell. Until the start of your next turn, you are blinded and deafened to your surroundings as your mind traces back the years of sentient contact the object has experienced. You witness flashes of times when creatures with an Intelligence score of 4 or higher interacted with the object or moved within 10 feet of it, going back a number of years equal to your Psionic ability modifier. If any of these creatures are individuals that you are aware of by description or have previously met, your attention is automatically drawn to any scenes involving them. Each scene begins six seconds before a creature approaches within 10 feet of the object, and ends six seconds after it moves more than 10 feet away. However long inspecting the memories gathered around an object seems to take from your perspective, it takes no more than six seconds in real time for you to process the information.

expressive-mantra.name: Compelling Notion
expressive-mantra.description: The space within 5 feet of your focus field is permanently under the effects of a Zone of Truth spell.

expressive-mantra.name: Dissolve Into the Universe
expressive-mantra.description:
As an action, you can spend 10 ki points to safely sever your mind from your body and send it forth in your focus field, perceiving through its senses until the end of your next turn. When you are piloting your focus field in this way, it has no maximum range, it gains the benefit of your own senses, and its speed increases to 500 feet. You can use your action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. While perceiving through the field, you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings.

If your focus field is outside of its normal maximum range when this connection ends, you are stunned for 1 minute as your mind traverses time and space to return to your body.

expressive-mantra.name: Time's Mirror
expressive-mantra.description:
Once per turn when a creature your focus field is within 5 feet of makes an attack roll, you can spend 3 ki points to crystallize the moment in abstract time. As a bonus action on your following turns, you can reflect the moment back out into the present, causing an apparition of the creature to emerge from your focus field and make the same attack against a creature of your choice within the attack's range, using the same attack roll as when it was crystallized.

You can make this special attack as a bonus action only once per minute, unless you voluntarily reduce your Psi Die by one die size to use it again.

A moment crystallized in this way fades when you complete a short or long rest or use this feature again.

expressive-totem.name: Ancestral Chorus
expressive-totem.description: As a bonus action that expends 1 of your ki points, your spirit guide can summon the echoes of its fellow elders to surround it for 1 minute in a tumultuous parliament. Creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the spirit guide are considered defeaned by the overlapping voices.

expressive-totem.name: Ancestral Connection
expressive-totem.description: Your guide attempts to connect a creature to the replenishing harmony of its ancestral energy. As an action that expends 1 of your ki points, your spirit guide can touch one willing creature and roll your Psi Die. The target expends one of its Hit Dice, regaining hit points equal to the number rolled. If the number rolled on the expended Hit Die and your Psi Die are the same, the target doubles then number of hit points it regains.

expressive-totem.name: Ancient Knowledge
expressive-totem.description:
Choose four spells from the Primal spell list to learn, each of which must be of a level less than or equal to half your mystic level, rounded up.

You can cast the each of the spells by expending ki points equal to twice the spell's level. Your Psionic ability is your spellcasting ability for them, and they do not require components unless their material components have a listed gold cost.

If you cast a spell of 6th-level or higher, you cannot spend ki points to cast it again until you finish a long rest.

expressive-totem.name: Animal Guide
expressive-totem.description:
As an action that expends 2 ki points, your spirit guide can transform into a beast you have seen with a challenge rating of 1 or lower for 10 minutes. While it is transformed, the following rules apply:
  • Its game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but it retains its alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It also retains all of its skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in the stat block is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus instead of yours.
  • When it transforms, it assumes the beast's hit points and Hit Dice. When it reverts to its normal form, you return to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. However, if it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce its normal form to 0 hit points, it doesn't disappear.
  • Its ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of its beast form.
  • It can't use any of its special senses, such as darkvision, unless its new form also has that sense.
When the effect expires, you can immediately spend 1 further ki point to extend the duration for a further 10 minutes.

expressive-totem.name: Elder Aegis
expressive-totem.description: Your spirit guide's Armor Class increases by 2.

expressive-totem.name: Grave Vigil
expressive-totem.description: When your spirit guide rolls a 1 or 2 on an attack roll made against an undead, it can treat the roll as a 3.

expressive-totem.name: Gripping Visions
expressive-totem.description: When your spirit guide successfully grapples a creature, it can expend 1 of your ki points to fill the creature's mind with a fog of ancestral visions. Until the creature is freed from the grapple, it is also considered blinded.

expressive-totem.name: Guarded Medicines
expressive-totem.description: When your spirit guide makes a successful Wisdom (Medicine) check to stabilize a dying creature, it can expend 1 of your ki points to heal the creature as well. The target regains hit points equal to one roll of your Psi Die, and also gains an equal number of temporary hit points.

expressive-totem.name: Primal Beyond
expressive-totem.description:
Your spirit guide brings with it a part of the elemental barrier that swirls between this world and the next. Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. Your spirit guide gains resistance to the chosen damage type, and when it hits a creature with an attack, it can deal additional damage of the chosen type equal to one roll of your Psi Die.

You can choose this totem more than once; when your guide hits a creature with an attack, you can roll an additional Psi Die for each damage type chosen through this totem, expending 1 ki point for each die rolled beyond the first.

expressive-totem.name: Shared Hope
expressive-totem.description: When your spirit guide makes an attack roll, you can expend 2 ki points to roll your Psi Die and add the number rolled to the result of its attack.

expressive-totem.name: Soulful Host
expressive-totem.description: Your spirit guide's maximum hit points increase by twice your mystic level.

flourish.name: Artful Avoidance
flourish.description: When you use your Second Wind, you can immediately move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

flourish.name: Circle Step
flourish.description: When you take the Attack action and hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can immediately move up to 5 feet, as long as the creature remains within your reach. You can make this movement for each attack you make using the Attack action.

flourish.name: Crafty Escape
flourish.description: You can use a bonus action to attempt to escape a grapple where it would normally require an action.

flourish.name: Expert Throw
flourish.description: Once on each of your turns, when you make a ranged weapon attack using a weapon with the thrown property, you can immediately move up to 10 feet in a straight line toward or away from the target of the attack. In addition, your range with such weapons is increased by 20 feet.

flourish.name: Fluid Motion
flourish.description: When you are prone, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement. In addition, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement.

flourish.name: Flying Pirouette
flourish.description: Your jump distance is doubled. In addition, you have resistance to damage from falling and you do not land prone after falling.

flourish.name: Heroic Charge
flourish.description: You can give yourself a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your proficiency bonus. At the start of your first turn of each combat, your walking speed increases by 5 feet, which lasts until the end of that turn.

flourish.name: Interposing Strike
flourish.description: When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can immediately move up to 10 feet before making the attack, as long as the creature remains within your reach.

flourish.name: Masterful Bladework
flourish.description: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls with polearms and all weapons with the light property

flourish.name: Quick Defense
flourish.description: When a creature misses you with an attack, you can immediately use your reaction to move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

flourish.name: Sustained Momentum
flourish.description: You can use a bonus action on your turn to move up to 10 feet.

flourish.name: Uncanny Accuracy
flourish.description: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

flourish.name: Dance of Blades
flourish.description: When you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to move up to 10 feet. This can be done for multiple attacks, but not all of them.

flourish.name: Flowing Performance
flourish.description: When you use your Action Surge, you can take one additional bonus action.

flourish.name: Leaping Strike
flourish.description: When you use your Action Surge, and you are wielding a melee weapon with both hands, you can increase your reach with that weapon by 5 feet until the end of your next turn.

fighting-style.name: Aggressive Grappler
fighting-style.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.

fighting-style.name: Archery
fighting-style.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with ranged weapons.

fighting-style.name: Berserkergang
fighting-style.description: You fight with reckless abandon in battle. Once per turn, you can grant yourself advantage on a single attack roll. Once you take this advantaged attack, your Armor Class is reduced by 2 until the beginning of your next turn.

fighting-style.name: Blind Fighting
fighting-style.description: You have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

fighting-style.name: Brawling
fighting-style.description:
Your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier on hit. If you have two free hands and use your action to make only unarmed strikes you can make a single unarmed strike as a bonus action on that turn.

In addition, at the start of each of your turns, you can deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you.

fighting-style.name: Charger
fighting-style.description: When you use your action to Dash, you can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack or to shove a creature.

fighting-style.name: Classical Swordplay
fighting-style.description: While wielding a finesse weapon and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to your attack rolls and a +1 to your Armor Class so long as you are not using heavy armor or a shield.

fighting-style.name: Close-Quarters Shooter
fighting-style.description: When making a ranged attack while you are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll. Your ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover against targets within 30 feet of you. You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls on ranged attacks.

fighting-style.name: Critical Momentum
fighting-style.description: On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action. You must be wielding a heavy weapon to use this skill.

fighting-style.name: Crusher
fighting-style.description: When you score a critical hit that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.

fighting-style.name: Deep Cut
fighting-style.description: When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

fighting-style.name: Defensive Fighting
fighting-style.description: While wearing armor or wielding a shield, you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

fighting-style.name: Dual Wielding
fighting-style.description: When you take the Attack action while two-weapon fighting, you can make a single additional attack with your off-hand weapon as part of your action instead of your bonus action, adding your ability modifier to the damage of this attack.

fighting-style.name: Dueling
fighting-style.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with it.

fighting-style.name: Featherweight Fighting
fighting-style.description: While you are wielding only light weapons, your movement speed increases by 10 feet and you gain a +2 bonus to your damage rolls, so long as you are not wearing medium armor, heavy armor, or wielding a shield.

fighting-style.name: Great Weapon Fighting
fighting-style.description: Before you make a melee attack with a heavy weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

fighting-style.name: Heavyweight Fighting
fighting-style.description: You use your weight, and that of your weapon, to land devastating blows. While you are wielding a heavy weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to Shove.

fighting-style.name: Improvised Fighting
fighting-style.description: You gain proficiency with improvised weapons. Once per turn, when you hit with a improvised weapon attack, you can roll the damage die twice and take the higher roll. When you do this, the improvised weapon is destroyed and cannot be used for further attacks. You can't use this feature to destroy magical objects.

fighting-style.name: Interception
fighting-style.description: When a creature you can see hits a target, other than you, within 5 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the target takes by 1d10 + your proficiency bonus (to a minimum of 0 damage). You must be wielding a shield or a simple or martial weapon to use this reaction.

fighting-style.name: Mounted Warrior
fighting-style.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack while riding a mount, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw against your Exploit save DC. On a failed save, a Large or smaller target is knocked prone.

fighting-style.name: Marine Fighting
fighting-style.description: When you are not wearing medium or heavy armor, or using a shield, you have a swimming speed equal to your movement speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

fighting-style.name: Melee Marksman
fighting-style.description:
When you make a ranged attack targeting a creature within 5 feet of you, you do not have disadvantage on the attack roll.

If you make a ranged attack against a creature within 5 feet, you can use a bonus action to strike the creature with your ranged weapon, dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage on hit.

fighting-style.name: Mountain Fighting
fighting-style.description: When you are not wearing medium or heavy armor, or using a shield, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

fighting-style.name: Piercer
fighting-style.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

fighting-style.name: Pit Fighting
fighting-style.description:
Your have trained to fight with weapons typically associated with gladiators, granting you the following benefits:
  • When making an attack roll with a net against a creature within 5 feet, you do not have disadvantage on the roll.
  • When you take the Attack action on your turn, making an attack with a net only takes the place of one attack.

fighting-style.name: Precision Shooter
fighting-style.description: Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

fighting-style.name: Protection
fighting-style.description: When a creature you can see hits you, or a target within 5 feet, with a melee attack, you can use a reaction to add your proficiency bonus to the target's Armor Class against that attack. You must be wielding a shield or a melee weapon.

fighting-style.name: Savage Attacker
fighting-style.description: Once per turn when you roll damage for a weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.

fighting-style.name: Sharpshooter
fighting-style.description: Before you make an attack with a ranged weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

fighting-style.name: Shield Warrior
fighting-style.description: While wielding a shield, if you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.

fighting-style.name: Slasher
fighting-style.description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

fighting-style.name: Standard Bearer
fighting-style.description: When a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack against a creature that you can see, you can grant them advantage on their attack roll as a reaction. You must be carrying a banner, flag, or standard in your hand to use this reaction.

fighting-style.name: Strongbow
fighting-style.description: You can use your Strength modifier, in place of Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons. When you do so, you gain a +1 to damage rolls with those weapons.

fighting-style.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
fighting-style.description:
You can draw a weapon that has the thrown property as part of the attack you make with the weapon.

In addition, when you hit with a ranged attack using a thrown weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

fighting-style.name: Versatile Fighting
fighting-style.description: While wielding a single versatile weapon and no shield, you gain a +1 bonus to your attack rolls with that weapon. While doing so, you can also use your bonus action to make a single grapple or shove attack, or to take the Use an Object action.

fighting-style.name: Wrestler
fighting-style.description: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can attempt to grapple that creature as a bonus action on that turn, so long as your have a free hand to do so. Also, you can drag grappled creatures up to your full movement speed.

fighting-style.name: Arcane Warrior
fighting-style.description: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Arcane spell list. When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another Arcane cantrip.

fighting-style.name: Blessed Warrior
fighting-style.description: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Divine spell list. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the Divine spell list.

fighting-style.name: Druidic Warrior
fighting-style.description: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Primal spell list. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the Primal spell list.

fighting-style.name: Esoteric Warrior
fighting-style.description: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Occult spell list. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the Occult spell list.

fighting-style.name: Musical Warrior
fighting-style.description: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Melodic spell list. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the Melodic spell list.

fighting-style.name: Psychic Warrior
fighting-style.description: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Psionic spell list. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the Psionic spell list.

grenade.name: Flashbang Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a blinding flash of light. All creatures within 15 feet of it that can see it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature is blinded until the start of your next turn.

This grenade's radius increases to 30 feet at 7th level and it also stuns creatures that fail their saving throws at 15th level.

grenade.name: Fragmentation Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it scatters fragments of white-hot metal across the battlefield. All creatures within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 piercing damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 7th level and 6d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Razor Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it scatters razors in its explosion. All creatures within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 slashing damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 7th level and 6d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Smoke Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, a thick cloud of smoke emits from it in a 10-foot sphere centered on it, which disperses after 1 minute. The area within the smoke is considered heavily obscured. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) immediately disperses it.

This grenade's radius increases to 20 ft at 7th level and 30 ft at 15th level.

grenade.name: Sticky Grenade
grenade.description:
When you throw this grenade, you can make a ranged weapon attack against a creature within range. On a hit, it sticks to them. At the end of your next turn, it detonates, dealing 2d6 bludgeoning damage to the target.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 7th level and 6d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Tranquilizer Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a cloud of sleep-inducing gas in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on itself, which disperses after 1 minute. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) immediately disperses it.

When a creature starts its turn in the gas, roll 3d8. If the total is higher than the creature's current hit points, it falls asleep for one minute, until they take damage, or someone within 5 feet of them uses an action to shake or slap them awake.

This grenade's radius increases to 20 feet at 7th level, and the dice rolled by its effect increases to 6d8 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Wind-Up Grenade
grenade.description:
This grenade can be set with a timer with a length of 1 to 10 rounds. After the timer expires, it detonates, creating a simple exploison. All creatures within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 7th level and 6d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Corrosive Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it splashes acid over the nearby area. All creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 acid damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

In addition, creatures that fail their saving throws have their Armor Class reduced by an amount equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down, minimum of -1) for 1 minute.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Cryo Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a blast of sheer cold. All creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 cold damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

In addition, this grenade freezes the ground within 15 feet of it, causing the surface to become slippery. When the ice appears, each creature standing in its area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. The ice lasts for 1 minute.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Incendiary Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it spews flaming napalm. Creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 1d6 fire damage and is set alight, taking half as much damage and not being set alight on a successful saving throw.

At the start of each of its turns for the next minute or until the flames go out, an affected creature takes 1d6 fire damage. On a successful save, the flames go out. A creature can use an action to douse the flames of itself or a creature within 5 feet of it.

Each instance of this grenade's damage increases to 2d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Ion Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a blast of electrical bolts. All creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw. Constructs have disadvantage on the saving throw.

In addition, creatures that fail their saving throw can't take reactions until the start of your next turn, and drop one metal object they are holding of your choice.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Paralytic Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, all creatures within 15 feet of it that can see it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature is paralyzed until the start of your next turn.

This grenade's radius increases to 30 feet at 15th level.

grenade.name: Poison Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a cloud of poisonous gas in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on itself, which disperses after 1 minute. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) immediately disperses it.

When a creature starts its turn in the gas, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 poison damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Tar Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it spews sticky black tar and creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature is covered in tar and is restrained for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the tar off itself or another creature.

At 15th level, this grenade restrains a target enough to make it impossible for them to scrape or wash the tar off of themselves, though another creature can scrape or wash the tar off.

grenade.name: Sonic Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates an ear-splitting blast of sound. All creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 thunder damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

Any fragile materials, such as glass, porcelain, or ice, within the grenade's radius shatter, and other objects within the grenade's radius take twice as much damage as a creature would.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Enervation Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it saps the life from living things within range. All creatures within 15 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 2d6 necrotic damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

In addition, creatures that fail their saving throw also have their maximum hit points reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. Plant creatures and water elementals have disadvantage on their saving throws, and non-creature plants within range simply wither and die.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d6 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Enigma Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a blast of pure void energy. All creature within 15 feet of it take 2d4 damage. This damage is untyped, and as such cannot be reduced or prevented in any way.

This grenade's damage increases to 4d4 at 15th level.

grenade.name: Magnetic Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a powerful magnetic field. Tiny objects made of metal within 15 feet of the grenade are pulled to it when the grenade detonates, and again at the start of each of your turns for the next minute. If a creature is holding an object pulled by the grenade, it can make a Strength saving throw to resist its effect.

A creature can use an action to attempt to pull an object stuck to the grenade off of it, making a Strength (Athletics) check against your Explosives save DC in order to do so. On a success, a creature can pull the object off of the grenade.

This grenade's radius increases to 30 feet at 15th level.

grenade.name: Plasma Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a blast of super-heated gases that burn anything they come in contact with. All creatures within 15 ft of it must make a Consitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 4d6 radiant damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw. Fiends and undead make this save at disadvantage.

In addition, creatures that fail their save are blinded for 1 minute.

This grenade's radius increases to 30 ft at 15th level.

grenade.name: Anti-Gravity Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a field of anti-gravity in a 15-foot sphere centered on it for the next minute.

Large or smaller creatures and objects within the anti-gravity field levitate 5 feet off of the ground. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected.

An affected creature can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. Affected creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws.

grenade.name: Disintegration Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it atomizes everything within its blast radius. All creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 4d6 force damage, taking half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

Objects within the grenade's radius take twice as much damage as a creature would. Any object or creature reduced to 0 hit points from this grenade are disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of the True Resurrection or Wish spells.

grenade.name: Singularity Grenade
grenade.description:
When this grenade detonates, it creates a tiny singularity at its location for the next minute. Creatures that start their turn within 30 feet of the singularity must make a Strength saving throw or be pulled 15 feet closer to it, being pulled prone if they end their move within 5 feet of the singularity.

Any creature within 15 feet of the singularity must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving away from the singularity.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Joyous Youth
gift-of-damnation.description: At the beginning of your turn, if you have no remaining Hit Dice, you can choose to make a DC 10 Charisma saving throw. On a success, you regain 1 spent Hit Die. If you fail, you suffer 1d6 psychic damage.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Unfettered Glory
gift-of-damnation.description: When you hit a creature with a melee attack or melee spell attack, you can add your Charisma modifier to the damage dealt.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Unsurpassed Fortune
gift-of-damnation.description:
Whenever a creature makes an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw within 20 feet, after the GM has rolled but before they have determined the result, you can use your reaction to roll a d20. If you roll a 10 or higher, the attack roll, saving throw, or skill check immediately fails.

You cannot do this again until you complete a long rest.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Liberating Freedom
gift-of-damnation.description: As a bonus action, you can manifest a pair of leathery wings. You gain a fly speed equal to your current speed. These wings recede if you dismiss them as a bonus action on your turn, or if you are knocked unconscious. You cannot manifest your wings while wearing heavy armour. You can manifest your wings while wearing medium or light armour if it is made to accommodate them.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Prodigious Talent
gift-of-damnation.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Unconditional Love
gift-of-damnation.description: Whenever a creature fails a Charisma saving throw due to a spell or magical ability you control, you can use your reaction to gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 + your character level.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Second Chances
gift-of-damnation.description: If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to roll a Hit Die. If you do, your hit point total becomes the Hit Die result instead.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Expansive Knowledge
gift-of-damnation.description:
When you complete this contract for the first time, you learn additional spells from any spell list equal to your Charisma modifier. You must have a spell slot level equal to or greater than each of these spells.

While you have the effects of this contract, you know these spells in addition to your total Spells Known.

gift-of-damnation.name: Gift of Unbridled Power
gift-of-damnation.description: Upon completing a short rest, you can spend 1 Hit Die and regain any number of spell slots whose total is equal to or less than the result of the Hit Dice. If you do, you take psychic damage equal to the number of spell slot levels you regained.

infusion.name: Adaptation Armor
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor or set of clothing

The wearer is considered acclimated to all environments, and does not need to breathe.

infusion.name: Adjustable Tool Set
infusion.description:
Item: a set of artisan's tools (requires attunement)

The wielder is considered proficient with this magical set of tools, and as an action, they can transform this set of tools into another set of artisan's tools of their choice.

At 11th level, this magical tool set grants a +1 bonus to ability checks. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Arcane Firearm
infusion.description:
Item: a rod, wand, or Tiny object

This object is infused with a cantrip of your choice from any spell list. As an action on its turn, a creature that holds this object can produce the imbued cantrip.

infusion.name: Arm Launcher
infusion.description:
Item: a glove or gauntlet

This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object, including but not limited to; ball bearings, a vial of acid, or holy water. As an attack, the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged weapon attack at a target up to 30 feet away. The launcher can be reloaded as a bonus action.

infusion.name: Bane Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a simple or martial weapon

This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

A bane weapon is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. Some are more focused than others; for example, there are both weapons of dragon slaying and weapons of blue dragon slaying. If a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with an arrow of slaying takes damage from the arrow, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one.The weapon has 4 charges. When the wielder hits a creature belonging to the type, race, or group associated with the weapon, you can expend 1 charge and inflict an additional 2d6 damage of the weapon's type with the attack. The weapon regains 1d4 charges daily at dawn.

infusion.name: Boots of False Crowds
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of boots

While wearing these boots, the wearer can use a bonus action to click the boots' heels together, making its steps sound as if a large crowd is moving at its location. The sound produced by the boots matches with the current speed of the wearer, and this sound also interacts with its environment. For example, if the wearer is running across a wet surface, the boots will create the sound of a large crowd running accompanied by splashing water. However, the boots can't replicate vibrations or other tactile sensations that would normally result from an actual crowd of people. The wearer can use a bonus action to end this effect.

infusion.name: Enhanced Arcane Focus
infusion.description:
Item: a rod, staff, or wand (requires attunement)

This item grants the user +1 bonus to spell attack rolls, and they can ignore half cover when making spell attacks.

This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

infusion.name: Enhanced Defense
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor or a shield

This item grants the user +1 bonus to their armor class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) this infused item.

This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

infusion.name: Enhanced Instrument
infusion.description:
Item: a musical instrument (requires attunement)

The wielder is proficient with this magic instrument and can use it as a spellcasting focus. Whenever they make an ability check using this instrument, they gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

At 11th level, this magic instrument grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Enhanced Tool Set
infusion.description:
Item: a set of tools you are proficient with

Whenever the wielder uses these tools as part of an ability check, it gains a bonus to that ability check equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

infusion.name: Enhanced Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a simple or martial weapon

This magic weapon grants the user a +1 bonus to any attack and damage rolls they make with this infused weapon.

This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

infusion.name: Featherweight Belt
infusion.description:
Item: a belt or cloak (requires attunement)

When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.

At 11th level, it reduces the wearer to one-hundredth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.

infusion.name: Featherweight Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a heavy or two-handed weapon (requires attunement)

This magic weapon loses the heavy property if it had it. If it did not have the heavy property, it gains the light property.

At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Floating Cape
infusion.description:
Item: a cape, cloak, or set of robes (requires attunement)

This magic item has 4 charges. When the wearer is knocked prone, it can use its reaction and expend 1 charge to immediately get up from prone. As part of the same reaction, the wearer can give itself a flying speed of 10 feet until the start of its next turn and move up to this distance without provoking opportunity attacks. The item regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.

infusion.name: Goggles of Clearsight
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of goggles or glasses

While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through areas that are lightly obscured by magical or mundane phenomena without disadvantage on Perception checks.

In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects of the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, and they have advantage on saving throws to resist becoming blinded.

infusion.name: Helm of Sharp Senses
infusion.description:
Item: a helmet (requires attunement)

The wearer of this helmet gains a bonus to its Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks equal to your Intelligence modifier. This may stack with your own modifier if you are the one wearing it.

infusion.name: Helm of Willpower
infusion.description:
Item: a helmet (requires attunement)

This helmet has 4 charges. When the wearer makes a saving throw against being charmed or frightened, the wearer can use its reaction to expend 1 charge and make the roll with advantage. The helmet regains 1d4 charges daily at dawn.

infusion.name: Homonculus Servant (Mechanical)
infusion.description:
Item: a gem or crystal worth at least 100 gp

You learn intricate methods for magically creating a special homunculus that serves you. The item you infuse serves as the creature's heart, around which the creature's body instantly forms.

You determine the homunculus's appearance. Some artificers prefer mechanical-looking birds, whereas some like winged vials or miniature, animate cauldrons.

The homunculus is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See this creature's game statistics in the Homunculus Servant stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, the homunculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the homunculus can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

The homunculus regains 2d6 hit points if the mending spell is cast on it. If you or the homunculus dies, it vanishes, leaving its heart in its space.

infusion.name: Minor Magic Item
infusion.description:
Item: variable

Choose any common magic item. Your infusion replicates the function of your chosen magic item.

infusion.name: Minor Spellstoring Item
infusion.description:
Item: one Tiny object, tool, or weapon (requires attunement when not used by its creator)

You imbue this object with magical power. Each time you imbue this infusion into an object, you choose a 1st-level spell from any spell list to imbue. The creature that holds this object can expend one of its charges to cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time.

If the spell requires concentration, the creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.

You can imbue this infusion with more arcane charges, allowing for more castings of the imbued spell before the item becomes inert.

infusion.name: Parrying Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a weapon

While wielding this weapon, the wielder gains a +1 bonus to their Armor Class.

This bonus increases to +2 at 10th level.

infusion.name: Penetrating Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a weapon

This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When the wielder makes a ranged attack with the weapon, it ignores half and three-quarters cover.

infusion.name: Power Whip
infusion.description:
Item: a chain weapon

This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and its damage die becomes a d8 if it was smaller.

This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

infusion.name: Repeating Shot
infusion.description:
Item: a ranged weapon (requires attunement)

This magic weapon ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition into the weapon it produces its own, creating magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack. The ammunition vanishes after it either hits or misses.

At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Returning Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a weapon with the thrown property

After making a ranged attack this magic weapon, regardless if the attack hits or misses its target, it instantaneously returns to its wielder's hand.

At 11th level this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Ring of Proficiency
infusion.description:
Item: a ring (requires attunement)

The wearer of this ring gains proficiency in one skill or set of tools that you are proficient in (your choice upon infusion).

infusion.name: Tactician's Amulet
infusion.description:
Item: an amulet or pendant

While wearing this amulet, a creature can choose to use its Intelligence modifier in place of its Dexterity modifier when rolling for initiative.

infusion.name: Boots of the Wind
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of boots (requires attunement)

These boots have 3 charges. While wearing these boots, the wearer's walking speed increases by 5 feet. The wearer can also expend 1 charge to use the Dash action as a bonus action. The boots regain 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

infusion.name: Greater Magic Item
infusion.description:
Item: varies

Choose any uncommon magic item. Your infusion replicates the function of your chosen magic item.

infusion.name: Greater Spellstoring Item
infusion.description:
Item: one Tiny object, tool, or weapon (requires attunement when not used by its creator)

You imbue this object with magical power. Each time you imbue this infusion into an object, you choose a 2nd-level spell from any spell list to imbue. The creature that holds this object can expend two of its charges to cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time.

If the spell requires concentration, the creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.

You can imbue this infusion with more arcane charges, allowing for more castings of the imbued spell before the item becomes inert.

infusion.name: Hazy Garments
infusion.description:
Item: a set of clothing (requires attunement)

The wearer if this set of garments is coated with an illusory mist that deceives the eye. A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing these garments.

Additionally, the wearer can move freely without provoking opportunity attacks.

The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 14th level in this class.

infusion.name: Homing Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a weapon with the ranged or thrown property

The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon's long range.

At 11th level it gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus becomes +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Immovable Boots
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of boots (requires attunement)

When the wearer is standing on a flat surface, it can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the wearer in place. Until the wearer uses an action to deactivate the boots, they do not move, even if they are defying gravity.

A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating the boots from the surface on a success.

infusion.name: Infiltrator Armor
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

This magic suit of armor retains its weight but is formfitting and wearable under clothes. The wearer of this armor has advantage on any Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

infusion.name: Light Blade
infusion.description:
Item: a sword hilt or wand (requires attunement)

While grasping the object, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or disappear, from the end of this object. While the blade exists, this magic item is considered a simple melee weapon with the finesse property, and it deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit.

The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet beyond that radius.

At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Magic Bomb
infusion.description:
Item: a throwable vessel such as a bottle, flask, jar, or urn

You infuse implosive power into an object which you can throw. You are proficient with these bombs.

As an action, you or any creature holding the Magic Bomb can throw it up to 60 feet away. Upon collision with any object or creature the magic bomb detonates affecting all creatures, objects, and structures in 20 foot radius. Each creature in this radius must make a Constitution save taking 2d6 thunder damage and 2d6 force damage and be pulled up to 10 feet towards where the magic bomb landed on a failed save or half as much damage and not pulled on a successful save. Objects & structures take double damage, and objects that aren't being held automatically fail this saving throw and fly to the center of the implosion.

At 10th level the damage increases to 3d6 thunder and 3d6 force.

You can imbue this infusion with more arcane charges, producing an additional bomb for each charge you expend.

infusion.name: Many-Handed Pouch
infusion.description:
Item: individual pouches equal to your Intelligence modifier

These magic pouches all share one interdimensional space with the capacity of a single pouch. Reaching into an infused pouch allows access to this shared storage space. A pouch operates as long as it is within 100 miles of another pouch; the pouch is otherwise empty and won't accept contents.

If the Infusion ends, the items stored in the shared space all move into one of the pouches, determined at random.

infusion.name: Mind Sharpener
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor or robes

This item can send a jolt to the wearer to refocus their mind. The item has 4 charges. When the wearer fails a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, they can use their reaction to spend 1 of the item's charges to succeed instead. The item regains all expended charges at dawn.

infusion.name: Radiant Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a melee weapon (requires attunement)

As a bonus action, the wielder can cause this weapon to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius, and dim light 30 feet beyond that. The wielder can extinguish the light as a bonus action.

This magical weapon has 4 charges. When its wielder hits a creature with this weapon, it can expend 1 charge and force its target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is blinded until the beginning of your next turn. This weapon regains all expended charges at dawn.

At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Repulsion Gauntlets
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of gloves or gauntlets (requires attunement)

These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When their wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike or gauntlet attack, it can expend 1 charge and force a Large or smaller target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet in a straight line. These gauntlets regain all of their expended charges at dawn.

At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Repulsion Shield
infusion.description:
Item: a shield (requires attunement)

This magic shield has 4 charges. When the wielder is hit by a melee attack, they can force a Large or smaller attacker to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is knocked back 15 feet in a straight line and falls prone. The shield regains all of its expended charges at dawn.

At 11th level this magic shield grants a +1 bonus to Armor Class. This Armor Class bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Ring of Holding
infusion.description:
Item: a ring (requires attunement)

As an action, a creature wearing this ring can touch an object that weighs 25 pounds or less and cause the object to be teleported to an empty demiplane and stored there. As long as an object is being stored this way, a creature wearing the ring can teleport the object into their hand as a bonus action. The ring can only store one object at a time.

infusion.name: Ring of Spell Refueling
infusion.description:
Item: a ring (requires attunement)

While wearing this magic ring, the wearer can use an action to recover one of its expended spell slots of 3rd-level or lower, or 5 sorcery points. Once used, the ring can't be used again until the next dawn.

infusion.name: Skyfall Harness
infusion.description:
Item: a cloak, vest, or harness

This magic harness automatically sizes to fit the wearer and can be worn over clothing or light armor. It has wing-like fins between its limbs that slow falls and allow wearers to glide.

When the wearer falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to 100 feet from its fall when calculating falling damage, and it can glide 2 feet horizontally every 1 foot that it falls.

infusion.name: Swift Ring
infusion.description:
Item: a ring (requires attunement)

This ring has 4 charges. Whenever the wearer of this ring takes the attack action, they can expend one of the charges to make one melee or ranged weapon attack as a bonus action. The ring regains 1d4 charges daily at dawn.

At 14th level, this magic ring grants an extra attack - which can stack with other versions of extra attack.

infusion.name: War Gauntlet
infusion.description:
Item: an armored gauntlet and a martial weapon or shield

You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two-handed properties, or a shield, to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this Infusion is active.

At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

infusion.name: Adrenaline Armor
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

A creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing this armor.

When the wearer drops to 0 hit points and is not killed outright, it can use its reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead. As part of the same reaction, the wearer can make one weapon attack or take the Dash action. The armor regains the use of this feature when the wearer finishes a long rest.

infusion.name: Advanced Magic Item
infusion.description:
Item: varies

Choose any rare magic item. Your infusion replicates the function of your chosen magic item.

infusion.name: Advanced Spellstoring Item
infusion.description:
Item: one Tiny object, tool, or weapon (requires attunement when not used by its creator)

You imbue this object with magical power. Each time you imbue this infusion into an object, you choose a 3rd-level spell from any spell list to imbue. The creature that holds this object can expend three of its charges to cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time.

If the spell requires concentration, the creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.

You can imbue this infusion with more arcane charges, allowing for more castings of the imbued spell before the item becomes inert.

infusion.name: Armor of Magical Strength
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

This magical armor grants its wearer a +1 bonus to its Armor Class, and its wearer can also use its Intelligence, in place of Strength, for Strength-based ability checks or saving throws.

This armor also has 4 charges. As a reaction when the wearer would be knocked prone or moved against their will, they can expend 1 charge to remain standing or not move. The armor regains all of its expended charges at dawn.

At 17th level, this armor grants a +2 bonus to Armor Class.

infusion.name: Boots of Earthquakes
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of boots (requires attunement)

The area within 5 feet of the wearer of these boots is considered difficult terrain for creatures of the wearer's choice.

infusion.name: Boots of the Winding Path
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of boots (requires attunement)

The wearer of these magical boots can use a bonus action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

infusion.name: Chameleon Armor
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

The wearer of this armor can use an action to render themselves invisible for 1 minute or until they attack or cast a spell.

infusion.name: Helm of Awareness
infusion.description:
Item: a helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

The wearer of this helm gains a bonus to its initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1), and cannot be surprised, so long as they are not incapacitated.

infusion.name: Horseless Carriage
infusion.description:
Item: a land vehicle such as a carriage, cart, or wagon

The vehicle no longer needs horses or other steeds to pull it, it can now propel itself. The vehicle has a speed of 50 feet. A creature on or inside the vehicle can give it a simple command in a language you speak such as "go straight", "turn left" or "follow this road" as an action. The vehicle will follow the given command provided it is simple enough.

infusion.name: Shoulder-Mounted Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a ranged weapon (requires attunement)

This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. As an action, a creature can mount the weapon onto its shoulder. It can also detach the weapon as an action, and the weapon can't be removed against the creature's will.

While the weapon is attached in this way, the weapon reloads itself automatically if it has the loading property and if the creature has enough ammunition for the weapon. The creature can also use a bonus action to make a ranged attack from it.

infusion.name: Splintershot Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a ranged weapon

This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. As an action the wielder of this weapon may cause it to fire a splintered piece of ammunition. All creatures in a 15-foot cone in front of the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take the weapon's normal damage, half damage on a successful save.

infusion.name: Telescoping Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a melee weapon

The wielder gains an additional 5 feet of reach with the weapon.

infusion.name: Vampiric Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a melee weapon (requires attunement)

When the wielder scores a critical hit with this weapon, the target takes an extra 2d6 necrotic damage, and the wielder gains temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Undead are immune to the effects of this Infusion.

At 17th level, the extra necrotic damage becomes 4d6.

infusion.name: Warding Armor
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor

While wearing this armor, a creature has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

infusion.name: Arcane Propulsion Armor
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

The wearer of this armor gains these benefits:

  • The wearer gains a +1 bonus to AC.
  • The wearer's walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • If the wearer is missing any limbs, the armor replaces those limbs - hands, arms, feet, legs, or similar appendages. The replacements function identically to the body parts they replace.
  • The wearer has a flying speed equal to their walking speed. The wearer falls if they end their turn in the air and nothing else is holding them aloft.
  • If the wearer flies at least 20 feet in a straight line towards a target and makes a melee attack against it, the target is pushed back 10 feet and takes an extra 1d8 force damage.

infusion.name: Collar of Taming
infusion.description:
Item: a metal circlet or collar (requires attunement)

The magic of this collar can tame even the wildest animals. You, and only you, can control any beast wearing this collar as if it were a trained mount. This collar does not work on beasts with an Intelligence score greater than your own.

infusion.name: Deflector Ring
infusion.description:
Item: a ring (requires attunement)

If the wearer is hit by an attack roll and can see the attacker, the wearer can use its reaction to deflect the attack to another creature it can see within 5 feet of it that isn't the attacker. If the attack roll would hit the chosen creature, then it takes the damage from the attack. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

infusion.name: Elemental Weapon
infusion.description:
Item: a melee weapon (requires attunement)

You infuse this magic weapon with elemental energy. Upon infusion, choose a command word and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. As a bonus action, the wielder can speak the weapon's command word and cause elemental energy to burst forth from the weapon until the command word is spoken again. On hit, the weapon deals an additional 1d6 of the chosen elemental damage.

At 17th level, the bonus elemental damage becomes 2d6.

infusion.name: Resistant Armor
infusion.description:
Item: a suit of armor (requires attunement)

This magical armor grants its wearer a +1 bonus to its Armor Class, and its wearer has resistance to one of the following damage types; acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder (your choice upon Infusion).

At 17th level, this armor grants a +2 bonus to Armor Class, and you can choose for this magical armor to grant its wearer resistance to psychic or force damage.

infusion.name: Ring of the Elements
infusion.description:
Item: a ring (requires attunement)

Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. When the wearer casts a spell of 3rd-level or lower that deals that damage type, it can activate the ring to cause its spell to deal maximum damage to one target of that spell. Once the wearer uses this ring to maximize the damage of a spell it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

At 17th level, it can be used on spells of 5th-level or lower.

infusion.name: Superior Magic Item
infusion.description:
Item: varies
