Choose any very rare magic item. Your infusion replicates the function of your chosen magic item.

infusion.name: Superior Spellstoring Item
infusion.description:
Item: one Tiny object, tool, or weapon (requires attunement when not used by its creator)

You imbue this object with magical power. Each time you imbue this infusion into an object, you choose a 4th-level spell from any spell list to imbue. The creature that holds this object can expend four of its charges to cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time.

If the spell requires concentration, the creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.

You can imbue this infusion with more arcane charges, allowing for more castings of the imbued spell before the item becomes inert.

infusion.name: Gauntlets of the Guardian
infusion.description:
Item: a pair of gauntlets (requires attunement)

These magic gauntlets are infused with wondrous arcane power. As a reaction when a Huge or smaller creature ends its turn within 30 feet of the wearer, it can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled 30 feet toward the wielder to an unoccupied space of its choice. If they pull the creature within 5 feet, the wielder can make a single melee weapon attack against it.

infusion.name: Helm of Mind Shielding
infusion.description:
Item: a helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

The wearer of this magic helm gains resistance to psychic damage and immunity to both the charmed and frightened conditions and magic that allows another creature to read their thoughts or telepathically communicate with them.

infusion.name: Masterwork Homunculus
infusion.description:
Item: a diamond worth at least 1000 gp and at least 1 cubic inch of flesh of the creature that is to be cloned, which the spell consumes. A vessel worth at least 2000 gp that has a sealable lid and is large enough to hold the creature being cloned, such as a huge urn, coffin, mud-filled cyst in the ground, or crystal container filled with salt water

You have discovered the secrets to the creation of life. You learn the Clone spell. You can cast Clone without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components available. Your clone only takes 12 days to reach maturity, but you can only have one.

If you replace this Infusion with another at any point before your clone reaches maturity, the spell immediately fails.

infusion.name: Ultimate Spellstoring Item
infusion.description:
Item: one Tiny object, tool, or weapon (requires attunement when not used by its creator)

You imbue this object with magical power. Each time you imbue this infusion into an object, you choose a 5th-level spell from any spell list to imbue. The creature that holds this object can expend five of its charges to cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time.

If the spell requires concentration, the creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.

You can imbue this infusion with more arcane charges, allowing for more castings of the imbued spell before the item becomes inert.

ki-technique.name: Arresting Strike
ki-technique.description:
When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point and force the target to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's speed is reduced to zero until the beginning of your next turn.

When you reach 11th level in this class, you can use this Technique once per turn without expending a Ki Point.

ki-technique.name: Crippling Strike
ki-technique.description:
When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to cripple its senses and force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is either blinded, deafened, or cannot speak (your choice) until the beginning of your next turn.

When you reach 11th level in this class, you can use this Technique once per turn without expending a Ki Point.

ki-technique.name: Empowered Strike
ki-technique.description:
When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point and force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked back in a straight line a number of feet equal to five times your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 5 feet), where it falls prone. Creatures that are at least once size larger than you have advantage on their Strength saving throw to resist this effect.

When you reach 11th level in this class, you can use this Technique once per turn without expending a Ki Point.

ki-technique.name: Improvised Strikes
ki-technique.description: You are adept at fighting with whatever is at hand. You gain proficiency with improvised weapons, they count as Martial Arts attacks for you, and you can use your Dexterity, in place of Strength, for improvised weapon attack and damage rolls.

ki-technique.name: Mystic Healing
ki-technique.description: You can use your Ki to stimulate natural healing. As an action, you can spend 1 Ki Point to regain hit points equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

ki-technique.name: Patient Defense
ki-technique.description:
You quiet your spirit, entering a defensive stance to better defend against incoming blows. You can spend 1 Ki Point to take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

When you reach 11th level in this class, you can use this Technique once per turn without expending a Ki Point.

ki-technique.name: Slow Fall
ki-technique.description: You move through the air as light as a feather. Any falling damage you would take is reduced by an amount equal to five times your monk level, so long as you are conscious.

ki-technique.name: Spiritual Armor
ki-technique.description:
You can reinforce your physical form with spiritual power. As an action, you can spend 1 Ki Point to gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

When a creature damages these temporary hit points, you can use your reaction to spend 1 Ki Point to cause them to take force damage equal to your Martial Arts die.

ki-technique.name: Step of the Wind
ki-technique.description: You move with the speed of the wind. You can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action. When you do so, your jump distance is doubled until the end of your current turn.

ki-technique.name: Whirling Strike
ki-technique.description: As an action, you can spend 1 Ki Point to strike out and force every creature within your reach to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take bludgeoning damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Dexterity modifier.

ki-technique.name: Adept Fighting Style
ki-technique.description: You have trained in a specialized style of fighting. You gain a Fighting Style of your choice from the list below. As a monk, you can only gain one Fighting Style through this Technique.

ki-technique.name: Crushing Strike
ki-technique.description: When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend Ki Points to deal extra bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 per Ki Point. The maximum amount of Ki you can spend at once on this Technique equals your Wisdom modifier.

ki-technique.name: Deflect Missiles
ki-technique.description:
As a reaction when you or a creature within 5 feet of you are hit by a ranged weapon attack, you can try to catch the projectile and reduce the damage by an amount equal to your monk level + Martial Arts die + your Dexterity modifier. If you reduce the incoming damage to 0 you catch the projectile if you have a free hand.

If you catch the projectile, you can make a ranged (20/60) Martial Arts attack with the projectile as part of the same reaction. You are proficient with this ranged weapon attack.

Starting at 11th level, you can spend 1 Ki Point as part of this reaction to deflect spells that require an attack roll.

ki-technique.name: Divine Light
ki-technique.description: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Divine spell list, and Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for it.

ki-technique.name: Gentling Touch
ki-technique.description:
In place of an attack, you can expend 1 Ki Point and touch a creature, and manipulate their Ki to put them to sleep. Roll your Martial Arts die five times. If the target's remaining hit points are less than or equal to the amount you rolled, they fall unconscious for 10 minutes. They wake up if they take damage or another creature uses an action to wake them.

You can expend additional Ki to increase the number of Martial Arts dice you roll for this technique. For each extra Ki Point you spend you can roll two more Martial Arts dice.

ki-technique.name: Seeking Strike
ki-technique.description: Your spirit will guide your strikes when your body fails. When you miss with a Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to re-roll your attack. You must use the new result.

ki-technique.name: Slowing Strike
ki-technique.description: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to interrupt their Ki flow, forcing the target to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature suffers the effects of the Slow spell until the start of your next turn. You do not need to concentrate on this effect.

ki-technique.name: Stunning Strike
ki-technique.description: When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 1 Ki Point to strike them with deadly force, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the beginning of your next turn.

ki-technique.name: Unyielding Perserverance
ki-technique.description: You can draw upon your Ki to find success in times of great need. When you make an ability check or saving throw, you can spend any number of Ki Points and add +1 bonus to your roll for each Ki Point you spend. You can use this feature after you roll, but before you know if you succeed or fail.

ki-technique.name: Aura Sight
ki-technique.description:
You can reach out with your Ki to sense your surroundings. You gain blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you are blinded or in darkness. You can see invisible creatures in that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

As you gain levels in this class the range of this blindsight increases; at 13th level (20 feet) and 18th level (40 feet).

ki-technique.name: Commune with Self
ki-technique.description: You have gained the ability to contact the Ki of your previous lives to gain information. As an action, you can spend 5 Ki Points to enter a meditative state, which lasts for 10 minutes, and consult your previous lives. At the end of your meditation, you gain the same information as if you had cast Commune.

ki-technique.name: Friend of Beast and Leaf
ki-technique.description: You can enter a meditative state to commune your Ki with that of the natural world around you. As an action, you can spend 5 Ki Points to enter this meditative state, which lasts for 10 minutes. At the end of your meditation, you gain the same information as if you had cast Commune With Nature.

ki-technique.name: Heavenly Step
ki-technique.description:
You can move along vertical surfaces, across liquids, and upside down on ceilings without falling during the move.

If you end your movement on a vertical surface, liquid, or upside down on a ceiling, you can spend 1 Ki Point to remain in place without falling until the beginning of your next turn.

ki-technique.name: Indomitable Spirit
ki-technique.description: You can augment your physical abilities with spiritual power. When you make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Athletics) check you can spend 1 Ki Point to add your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1) to your roll. You can use this Technique after you roll, but before you know if you succeed or fail.

ki-technique.name: Mantle of Courtesy
ki-technique.description: You gain proficiency in Persuasion and it becomes a Wisdom based skill for you. When you make a Wisdom (Persuasion) check you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

ki-technique.name: Monastic Fortitude
ki-technique.description: As a reaction when you take damage, you can expend 2 Ki Points to reduce the incoming damage by an amount equal to two rolls of your Marital Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

ki-technique.name: Armor of the Ascetic
ki-technique.description: You exude an aura of peace. At the end of a short or long rest, you gain the effects of Sanctuary, which lasts until the start of your next short or long rest. This spell ends early as normal.

ki-technique.name: Banishing Strike
ki-technique.description:
When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can expend 3 Ki Points to empower your blow with legendary force, and force the target to make a Charisma saving throw. It takes additional force damage equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die on a failure, and half as much on a success.

If this attack reduces the target to 50 hit points of fewer, it shunted to a harmless demiplane where it is incapacitated. The creature reappears in the unoccupied space nearest to the last space it occupied at the end of your next turn.

ki-technique.name: Conjure Previous Life
ki-technique.description:
You can draw upon the Ki of your previous lives and summon a specter of a past life to come to your aid. As an action, you can spend 5 Ki Points to cast Summon Celestial at 5th-level. When summoned, it has the following changes:
  • It is a Medium creature that resembles a humanoid monk, though it may not be the same race as you are.
  • Its attacks resemble unarmed strikes.
  • When summoned you can infuse it with a number of Ki Points of your choice, and your Ki Point maximum is reduced by the same amount while it is summoned. It can use the infused Ki to use any Techniques you know.

ki-technique.name: Enlightened Integrity
ki-technique.description: Your sense of self and strength of your will are unshakable. You are immune to the charmed, dominated, and frightened conditions.

ki-technique.name: Mystical Integrity
ki-technique.description: Your sense of self and strength of your will are unshakable. You are immune to any spell or effect that would alter your form or force you to teleport, unless you wish to be affected.

ki-technique.name: Tongue of Sun and Moon
ki-technique.description: You can touch the Ki of other minds and communicate with any creature that speaks language. Creatures that speak no languages can communicate and understand simple ideas.

ki-technique.name: Awaken the Third Eye
ki-technique.description: You can open your mind to the Ki that flows through all living things, allowing you to predict the actions of creatures before they happen. You can perform a 1 minute meditative ritual where you expend 8 Ki Points to cast Foresight, targeting only yourself. While this effect is active, your Ki Point maximum is reduced by 8. You can end this effect as an action.

ki-technique.name: Empty Body
ki-technique.description:
As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 4 Ki Points to become invisible for 1 minute. While invisible in this way, you gain resistance to all damage except for force damage.

You can also spend 8 Ki Points to cast Astral Projection, without needing material components. When you do so, you target only yourself and can't take other creatures with you.

ki-technique.name: Quivering Palm
ki-technique.description:
When you hit a creature with a melee Martial Arts attack, you can spend 5 Ki Points to infuse its spirit with imperceptible vibrations, which last for a maximum number of days equal to your monk level. So long as you and the creature are on the same plane of existence, you can use your action to end these vibrations, forcing the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. It is reduced to 0 hit points on a failed save and takes 10d10 necrotic damage on a successful save.

You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time and using this feature on another target harmlessly ends the effects on any other creatures.

ki-technique.name: Word of Creation
ki-technique.description: You can draw on your intimate knowledge of the Ki that flows through all things and speak a divine word of creation. As an action, you can spend 7 Ki Points to cast Divine Word, using Wisdom as your spellcasting modifier.

lesson.name: Ace Up the Sleeve
lesson.description: You learn a cantrip from the Arcane spell list.  In addition, you learn a 1st-level spell from the Arcane spell list, which you can cast once without expending a spell slot.  Your Leadership ability is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

lesson.name: Dodge!
lesson.description: When a creature within 60 feet of you is targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction to add your Exploit Die to its Armor Class, possibly turning a hit into a miss.

lesson.name: Empty Your Cup
lesson.description: As an action, you can allow a willing spellcaster who prepares spells to exchange one prepared spell for another available to them.  You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short rest.

lesson.name: Fly You Fools
lesson.description:
As an action, you may shout a command to flee to a number of creatures up to your Leadership modifier who can see or hear you. For the next minute, each of those creatures get one additional action on their turns. This action may only be used to take the Dash action.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short rest.

lesson.name: I Have the High Ground
lesson.description:
When a creature within 5 feet of you starts their turn, you can use your reaction to punish their hubris. Until the end of their turn, when the target hits you with an attack, they take bludgeoning damage equal to your Leadership modifier.

You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short rest.

lesson.name: If You Can Dodge a Wrench
lesson.description:
By repeatedly throwing objects at allies, you hone their reflexes. You may make ranged weapon attack rolls against allied creatures using Tiny objects, which deal no damage. For each of these attacks that hit a creature, they gain a +1 bonus to their AC against ranged attacks until their next long rest.

A creature can benefit from this feature only once, and regain the ability to do so when they finish a long rest.

lesson.name: Shield of the Passing Torch
lesson.description: When a creature within a range equal to your movement speed is targeted by an attack or spell, you can use your reaction to move adjacent to them and become the target in their stead.  This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

lesson.name: Stop Trying to Hit Me and Hit Me
lesson.description:
When you select this lesson at the end of a long rest, choose one willing creature with which you took the long rest. The target can make an attack against you, dealing normal damage on a hit.

Until they finish their next long rest, the target adds your Leadership modifier to damage rolls with the same type of attack.

maneuver.name: Bolstering Roar
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 1 fury point to bolster the conviction of your companions. Each creature of your choice other than yourself that is within 20 feet of you and which can see or hear you gain a Bolster die, a d4. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bolster die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can only have one Bolster die at a time.

maneuver.name: Hammering Lunge
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 1 fury point to make an attack with your horns against a target. You can choose to move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks before you make this attack.

maneuver.name: Launch Ally
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 1 fury point and choose a friendly creature within 5 feet of you that is the same size category as you or smaller. That creature can use its reaction to let you launch it to an unoccupied space you can see within a number of feet of it equal to twice your Strength score.

maneuver.name: Lockjaw
maneuver.description: As part of the Attack action, you expend 1 fury point to replace one attack you make with a special bite attack against a target. On a hit, the target must make a Strength saving throw if it's a creature that is up to one size category larger than you. On a failure, it is grappled.

maneuver.name: Skylaunch
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 1 fury point and spread your wings, launching 15 feet into the air. This maneuver doesn't expend your movement and doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. Creatures up to one size category larger than you that are within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone by a powerful gust of wind as you launch. You remain airborne until the start of your next turn or until you are incapacitated.

maneuver.name: Suppressing Gale
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 1 fury point to blast gusts of wind at your surroundings. Creatures up to one size category larger than you within 30 feet of you must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 feet when moving closer to you. The gale disperses gas or vapor, and extinguishes candles, torches, and smaller unprotected flames in the area. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn, until you become incapacitated, or until you choose to end it early (no action required).

maneuver.name: Thieving Talons
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 1 fury point to make an attack with your wings. On a hit, the must succeed on a Strength saving throw or drop one item of your choice that it's holding. The object lands at its feet.

maneuver.name: Brutal Dive
maneuver.description: As a bonus action that you can take while gliding or flying, you expend 2 fury points to dive up to your Glide & Fly speed directly downwards. If you move at least 30 feet during your dive, choose one creature up to one size category larger than you that is within melee range. The creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone. As part of the same bonus action, you can then immediately make a bite attack against the creature.

maneuver.name: Defiance
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 2 fury points to steel yourself against all attackers. Until the start of your next turn, you gain resistance to all damage.

maneuver.name: Fearsome Wound
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 2 fury points and make a claw attack against a target. On a hit, the target is wounded, causing it to bleed for an additional 1d6 damage at the end of its next turn. Additionally, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is frightened of you until the end of its next turn.

maneuver.name: Overbearing Sweep
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you expend 2 fury points and make a claw attack against a target. On a hit, the target must make a Strength saving throw if it's a creature that is up to one size category larger than you. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone.

maneuver.name: Reprisal
maneuver.description: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can expend 2 fury points and use your reaction to make a horn attack against the creature. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be unable to take reactions until the start of its next turn.

maneuver.name: Rising Wing
maneuver.description: As part of the Attack action, you can expend 2 fury points to replace one attack you make with a special wing attack against a target. On a hit, the target must make a Strength saving throw if it's a creature that is up to one size category larger than you. On a failure, you knock the target 20 feet upwards. At your option, you can choose to prevent the target from falling until the end of your turn.

maneuver.name: Battering Ram
maneuver.description: As an action, you can expend 3 fury points to move up to your speed as you charge in a straight line, during which you can enter other creatures' spaces and creatures have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against you. While charging, you can make a number of horn attacks against creatures within 5 feet of you as if you had taken the Attack action. One creature that is up to one size category larger than you and which you hit must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed forward to the end of your charge. If the target ends its movement adjacent to another creature or a solid object, both the pushed target and the creature or object take bludgeoning damage equal to 2d6 + your Strength modifier. This maneuver deals double damage to objects and structures.

maneuver.name: Tail Sweep
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you can expend 3 fury points to make a tail attack against up to two targets, both of which must be within your reach. Roll separately for each. If the attack hits, a target must make a Strength saving throw if it's a creature that is up to one size category larger than you. On a failed save, a target is pushed 15 feet away from you.

maneuver.name: Wrath
maneuver.description: As a bonus action, you can expend 3 fury points to make a claw attack against each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you.

maneuver.name: Wrest Magic
maneuver.description: When a spell effect passes within 30 feet of you, you can expend 3 fury points to use your reaction to redirect it to yourself. You become the target of the effect. If the effect creates an area, it is centered on you. If the spell requires you to make a saving throw, you have advantage on it. After the effects of the spell are resolved, you regain hit points equal to twice the level of the spell + your Constitution modifier. You can't target spells with a range of touch or self.

mental-discipline.name: Celerity I
mental-discipline.description: Your base movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on your turn.

mental-discipline.name: Celerity II
mental-discipline.description: Your movement speed increases by another 5 feet, and when you Dash, opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

mental-discipline.name: Celerity III
mental-discipline.description: Your movement speed increases by an additional 5 feet. Also, when you Dash, you ignore the effects of all difficult terrain, and you can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids without falling during your movement on that turn.

mental-discipline.name: Celerity IV
mental-discipline.description: When you make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage from a spell or effect, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the save, and only half damage if you fail.  Also, when you make a Dexterity check or saving throw, you can use your spellcasting ability score in place of Dexterity.

mental-discipline.name: Iron Durability I
mental-discipline.description: So long as you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield, your Armor Class is equal to 13 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

mental-discipline.name: Iron Durability II
mental-discipline.description: As a bonus action, you can spend 1 psi point to grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point)

mental-discipline.name: Iron Durability III
mental-discipline.description: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend 3 psi points and grant yourself resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn.

mental-discipline.name: Iron Durability IV
mental-discipline.description: You gain proficiency with all saving throws.

mental-discipline.name: Metamorphosis I
mental-discipline.description: You learn the Psionic Strike cantrip, and when you manifest psionic strike, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

mental-discipline.name: Metamorphosis II
mental-discipline.description: As a bonus action you can expend 1 psi point to transform, becoming Large or Tiny, gaining the respective benefits.  If you become Large, you gain temporary hit points equal to your psion level + your spellcasting ability modifier, your reach increases by 5 feet, and your melee attacks deal 1d4 extra damage on hit.  If you become Tiny, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and you can fit through 6 inch gaps without having to squeeze.

mental-discipline.name: Metamorphosis III
mental-discipline.description: As a bonus action you can spend 3 psi points to transform as if you had cast Polymorph on yourself. While transformed in this way you retain your mental ability scores and personality.

mental-discipline.name: Metamorphosis IV
mental-discipline.description: As a bonus action you can expend 5 psi points to transform, becoming Huge or Diminutive, gaining the following benefits.  If you become Huge, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your psion level + your spellcasting ability modifier, your reach increases by 10 feet, and your melee attacks deal 2d6 extra damage.  If you become Diminutive, you gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks, attacks made against you have disadvantage, and you can fit through 1 inch gaps without squeezing. While you are Diminutive, you are too small to make weapon attacks.

mental-discipline.name: Precognition I
mental-discipline.description: You cannot be surprised unless you are unconscious, asleep, or incapacitated, and you gain a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of +1).

mental-discipline.name: Precognition II
mental-discipline.description: As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can roll a d4 and add the result to your Armor Class against the triggering attack, potentially turning a hit into a miss.

mental-discipline.name: Precognition III
mental-discipline.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 3 psi points to enter a heightened precognitive state for 1 minute. While in this heightened state, attacks targeting you cannot be made at advantage, and critical hits become normal hits. You must concentrate on this ability as if concentrating on a spell.

mental-discipline.name: Precognition IV
mental-discipline.description: When you roll initiative you can use your reaction to take a special turn before anyone else acts. On this turn you can either use one action, one bonus action, or move up to your full movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Also, while you are in your heightened precognitive state, all attacks targeting you are made with disadvantage.

mental-discipline.name: Restoration I
mental-discipline.description: You learn the Spare the Dying cantrip, and when you manifest spare the dying, you can target a creature up to 30 feet away.

mental-discipline.name: Restoration II
mental-discipline.description: You have a pool of healing power that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times your psion level. As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool. You can't heal undead or constructs. Your healing pool replenishes when you finish a long rest.

mental-discipline.name: Restoration III
mental-discipline.description: As an action, you can touch a creature and spend 2 psi points to end one of the following conditions affecting that creature: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, or stunned.

mental-discipline.name: Restoration IV
mental-discipline.description: As an action, you can touch a creature that has died within the last minute and expend 3 psi points to immediately bring it back to life with 1 hit point. This ability has no effect on a creature that has died of old age or natural causes.

mental-discipline.name: Telekinesis I
mental-discipline.description: You learn the Mage Hand cantrip, and when you manifest it you don't need to provide the verbal or somatic components. Your mage hand is invisible, and it can lift number of pounds equal to 10 times your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 10).

mental-discipline.name: Telekinesis II
mental-discipline.description: You can manifest two instances of Mage Hand at one time, so long as they remain within 30 feet of each other. Manifesting two mage hands at once requires your concentration.

mental-discipline.name: Telekinesis III
mental-discipline.description: You learn the Telekinesis spell, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known. If you already know this spell you learn another psion spell of your choice. When you manifest it you don't need to provide the verbal components.

mental-discipline.name: Telekinesis IV
mental-discipline.description: You can cast telekinesis at will, without expending psi points.

mental-discipline.name: Telepathy I
mental-discipline.description: You can telepathically communicate with any creature you can see within 60 feet. You don't need to share a language, but the target must speak at least one language to respond. You can only communicate with one creature at a time.

mental-discipline.name: Telepathy II
mental-discipline.description: The range of your telepathy becomes 120 feet. As an action you can form a telepathic network connecting yourself and a number of creatures equal to your spellcasting ability modifier for 1 hour. So long as these creatures are within the range of your telepathy they can mentally communicate with each other.

mental-discipline.name: Telepathy III
mental-discipline.description: The range of your telepathy becomes 1 mile. To establish a telepathic connection with a creature that you can't see you must have previously connected telepathically with them. You can also telepathically fulfill the verbal component of any psion spell you manifest. Targets telepathically hear the verbal components of the spell in your voice in their head.

mental-discipline.name: Telepathy IV
mental-discipline.description: The range of your telepathy is the entirety of the plane you are on. Also, you can form a telepathic network connecting yourself and a number of creatures equal to your psion level. If the total number of creatures in your telepathic network exceeds 1 + your spellcasting ability modifier, you must concentrate on the network as if you were concentrating on a spell.

metamagic.name: Adamant Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell, you can spend Sorcery Points equal to 1 + the level of the spell to make it immune to anti-magic spells like Counterspell, Dispel Magic, or Antimagic Field.

metamagic.name: Adjacent Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that requires you to make a ranged spell attack while there is an enemy creature within 5 feet of you, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to make your ranged spell attack without disadvantage.

metamagic.name: Arcane Tenacity
metamagic.description: When you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration on a spell, you can expend 3 Sorcery Points as a reaction to add your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of +1) to the result of the saving throw. You can use this reaction after you roll, but before you know if you succeed or fail.

metamagic.name: Autonomous Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that requires concentration, you can spend 3 sorcery points to cast it without requiring concentration. You can have only one autonomous spell in effect at a time. If you use this metamagic to modify a second spell, the first autonomous spell ends.

metamagic.name: Bewildering Spell
metamagic.description: You can cast a spell that overwhelms the senses of its target. When you cast a spell that deals damage to one creature, you can spend 2 sorcery points to increase the intensity of the spell's visual effect. The target of your spell has disadvantage on the next Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw it makes within the next minute.

metamagic.name: Blinding Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals fire or radiant damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to force one target of the spell to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target blinded for one minute. The creature can repeat their saving throw at the start of each turn, ending the effect on a success.

metamagic.name: Brutal Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to empower the casting. If you roll the highest number of any of the spell's damage dice you can roll that die again and add it to the total damage. However, if you roll the lowest number on any of the spell's damage dice, you remove that die, and its damage, from the total damage of the spell.

metamagic.name: Careful Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that forces targets to make a saving throw, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to protect a number of creatures equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1). These creatures automatically succeed on their saving throw, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

metamagic.name: Cerebral Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that forces an Intelligence or Charisma saving throw, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points and change the spell's saving throw to target the other ability score instead.

metamagic.name: Concussive Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning or thunder damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to force one target of the spell to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is knocked prone. Large or larger creatures have advantage on their Strength saving throw.

metamagic.name: Contingent Spell
metamagic.description: You can cast a spell to be triggered at a later time. To do so, you must spend a number of sorcery points equal to the level of the spell slot used to cast the spell. You then use your reaction to trigger the spell when the event you stipulated when you cast the spell occurs.

metamagic.name: Distant Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell with a range of 5 feet or more, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to double its range. If you use this on a spell with a range of touch, its range becomes 30 feet.

metamagic.name: Dynamic Precense
metamagic.description: Choose either Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion. You gain proficiency in that skill, and when you make an ability check with that skill, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to grant yourself advantage on the roll. If you are already proficient in that skill, you gain proficiency in another skill of your choice. You can select this Metamagic ability more than once, but you must select a different skill proficiency each time.

metamagic.name: Elemental Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change the spell's damage type to another from the list above.

metamagic.name: Empowered Cantrip
metamagic.description: When you cast a sorcerer cantrip you can expend 1 Sorcery Point to increase the power of that cantrip to its next level.

metamagic.name: Empowered Spell
metamagic.description: After you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to re-roll a number of the damage dice up to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1), and use the new rolls. You can use Empowered Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic during the casting of the spell.

metamagic.name: Enlightening Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that targets a creature, you can spend 1 sorcery point to learn one of your target's resistances or immunities. Each time you use this metamagic option on the same creature, it reveals a new resistance or immunity.

metamagic.name: Esoteric Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals force, necrotic, psychic, or radiant damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change the damage type of the spell to another from the list above.

metamagic.name: Extended Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to double the spell's duration, up to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

metamagic.name: Fearful Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals damage to a creature, you can spend 3 sorcery points to make the target of your spell frightened of you until the end of your next turn. If your spell affects multiple targets, you can choose only one of the targets to be frightened.

metamagic.name: Forceful Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals damage to a creature, you can spend 1 sorcery point to push the target of your spell 10 feet away from you. If the spell affects multiple targets, you can choose only one of the targets to be pushed away from you.

metamagic.name: Heightened Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points to force one target of the spell to make their initial saving throw with disadvantage. The target makes subsequent saving throws as normal.

metamagic.name: Hidden Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell with a duration longer than instantaneous, you can spend 2 sorcery points to mask its magical aura. For the duration of your spell, it can't be detected or discerned with spells or effects, such as the detect magic spell or a chuul's Sense Magic trait

metamagic.name: Hungry Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals damage to a single target, you can spend 1 sorcery point to add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage roll of the spell. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a hungry spell, you regain hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).

metamagic.name: Imbued Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that has a range of self, you can spend Sorcery Points equal to 1 + the level of the spell to instead cast it with a range of touch, targeting a willing creature. If the spell requires concentration, the creature you cast the spell on must concentrate on the spell.

metamagic.name: Imbuing Touch
metamagic.description: As a bonus action, you can touch a nonmagical weapon and spend 1 Sorcery Point to imbue it with a spark of your magic. For the next minute, it counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

metamagic.name: Immaterial Spell
metamagic.description: You can cast a spell without providing costly material components. You must spend 1 sorcery point for every 100 gp in the cost of the material component required.

metamagic.name: Immutable Will
metamagic.description: When you would fail an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can use your reaction to spend 3 Sorcery Points to re-roll your saving throw, potentially turning failure into a success. You must use the result of the new roll.

metamagic.name: Kinetic Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that forces a Strength or a Dexterity saving throw, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points and change the spell's saving throw target the other ability score instead.

metamagic.name: Lingering Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a damaging spell with an instantaneous duration that requires a saving throw, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to prolong the spell's damage. A creature that failed its saving throw against your original casting of this spell must succeed on the same saving throw at the start of your next turn or take half of the spell's damage.

metamagic.name: Linked Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points and touch a willing creature within 5 feet, expending one of their spell slots to cast the spell in place of your Sorcery Points.

metamagic.name: Magical Guidance
metamagic.description: When you fail an ability check, you can use your reaction to spend 2 Sorcery Points to re-roll the d20. You must use the new d20 roll, potentially turning a failure into a success.

metamagic.name: Misdirecting Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that originates from you, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points to cause the spell to appear as if it had originated from a point you can see within 30 feet.

metamagic.name: Overcharged Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell has only one target, and requires you to make a ranged spell attackroll, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to increase the critical hit range of that spell, allowing you to score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

metamagic.name: Potent Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to have the spell to ignore a single target's resistances to the damage of the spell.

metamagic.name: Quickened Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to cast it as a bonus action.

metamagic.name: Recycled Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell using sorcery points, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to possibly conserve your arcane energy. If the spell misses or fails to take effect, you can use your reaction to regain half of the Sorcery Points you spent to cast the spell, including the Sorcery Point spent on this Metamagic (rounded down).

metamagic.name: Resolute Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that forces a Wisdom or a Constitution saving throw, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points and change the spell's saving throw target the other ability score instead.

metamagic.name: Robust Spell
metamagic.description: You can make a spell difficult for other spellcasters to counter or dispel by spending 2 sorcery points. A creature that must make an ability check to counter or dispel your spell has disadvantage on the check.

metamagic.name: Runious Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a damaging spell that targets an area, you can expend 3 sorcery points to cause the physical structure of the surroundings to crumble. The ground in the spell's area becomes difficult terrain.  A 5-foot square of difficult terrain created by this feature can be cleared with one minute of work.

metamagic.name: Sapping Spell
metamagic.description: You can increase the damage you deal with a spell by expending 2 sorcery points and up to half your remaining Hit Dice. Roll the Hit Dice and add the total result to the damage dealt by the spell. You then take damage equal to half the amount of damage your Hit Dice added to the spell's damage.

metamagic.name: Savage Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change the spell's damage type to another from the list above.

metamagic.name: Seeking Spell
metamagic.description: When you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to re-roll the d20. You must use the new d20 roll, potentially turning a missed attack into a hit. You can use Seeking Spell if you have already used a different Metamagic ability during the casting of the spell.

metamagic.name: Shared Hunger
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell on a friendly creature, you can spend 3 sorcery points to empower the creature's weapons. The creature's next weapon attack roll has advantage and, if the creature hits, you and the creature regain hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).

metamagic.name: Shielded Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell while you are within the area of effect of that spell, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to ignore the effects of that spell for the spell's entire duration.

metamagic.name: Silent Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast a version of that spell that produces no sound. However, you must still speak the verbal components of the spell aloud as this Metamagic only removes the sound of the spell itself.

metamagic.name: Sorcerous Fortitude
metamagic.description: As an action, you can spend a number of Sorcery Points, up to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1), to grant yourself 1d4 temporary hit points per Sorcery Point you spend.

metamagic.name: Sturdy Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that requires your concentration, you can spend Sorcery Points, up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), to empower your focus. For each Sorcery Point you spend, you gain a +1 bonus to the first saving throw you make to maintain your concentration on that spell.

metamagic.name: Subtle Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast it without providing any of the somatic or verbal components.

metamagic.name: Twinned Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that is incapable of hitting more than one target at the level at which you are casting it, and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend Sorcery Points equal to the level you cast the spell (1 Sorcery Point for cantrips) to target a second target within the range of the spell.

metamagic.name: Unerring Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that requires an attack roll or a Dexterity saving throw, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to ignore the effects of half and three-quarters cover.

metamagic.name: Unstable Spell
metamagic.description:
When you cast a spell that forces a target to make a saving throw, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to have the initial saving throw target an ability score determined by random chance. Roll a d6, and the spell's initial saving throw is changed to target the ability score from the list below.
d6 Saving Throw
1 Strength
2 Dexterity
3 Constitution
4 Intelligence
5 Wisdom
6 Charisma

misfortune.name: Curse of the Befuddled
misfortune.description: As an action you can spend 2 jinx points, and the creature marked by your evil eye is charmed for 10 minutes. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye, and the charmed condition ends early if you or your allies deal damage to the creature or cause it to make a saving throw. After the 10 minutes have elapsed, the creature knows you used magic to influence its mood and disposition towards you.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Clumsy
misfortune.description: When a creature marked by your evil eye moves 5 feet or more, you can use your reaction and spend 3 jinx points to cause the creature to fall prone and have its movement speed reduced to 0 until the end of the turn. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Debilitated
misfortune.description: When a creature marked by your evil eye takes damage, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to roll 1d12. The creature takes necrotic damage equal to the result.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Doomed
misfortune.description: After you miss with a weapon attack against a creature marked by your evil eye, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to make an additional weapon attack against the creature as part of the same action.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Fearful
misfortune.description: As an action you can spend 2 jinx points, and the creature marked by your evil eye is frightened for 1 minute. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye, and it can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this misfortune early on a success.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Inept
misfortune.description: After a creature marked by your evil eye makes an ability check or attack roll, but before the DM declares whether or not it is successful, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to make the creature reroll and use the lower result.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Insensate
misfortune.description: As an action you can spend 3 jinx points, and the creature marked by your ev eye is blinded and deafened for 1 minute. When you do, the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye, and it can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this misfortune early on a success.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Maimed
misfortune.description: When you hit a creature marked by your evil eye with a weapon attack, and the die result was 18 or 19, you can use your reaction and spend 2 jinx points to turn the hit into a critical.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Marked
misfortune.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 2 jinx points to enhance the effects of your evil eye on a creature you have marked by it. When you do, the duration increases to 24 hours or until you mark a different creature with your evil eye, whichever comes first. Additionally, while the creature is marked by your evil eye, you always know the direction and distance to the creature, provided you are on the same plane.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Plagued
misfortune.description: When a creature marked by your evil eye regains hit points, you can use your reaction and spend 1 jinx point to halve the amount of hit points regained. When you do, the creature can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Ruined
misfortune.description: After a creature marked by your evil eye makes a saving throw, but before the DM declares whether or not it is successful, you can use your reaction and spend 2 jinx points to make the creature reroll and use the lower result.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Somnolent
misfortune.description: As an action, you can spend 3 jinx points, and the creature marked by your evil eye becomes drowsy. Roll a number of d10 equal to your level in this class and add 15 to their total. If the creature's current hit points are equal to or less than the total, it goes unconscious. The target regains consciousness after 10 minutes, or when it takes damage or another creature uses its action to rouse it.

misfortune.name: Curse of the Unlucky
misfortune.description: As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 3 jinx points to put a pox on a creature marked by your evil eye. Whenever the creature makes an attack roll or saving throw, you roll 1d4 and subtract the result from their total. This pox ends when the creature is no longer marked by your evil eye.

subFeatures.name: Gold Luck
subFeatures.description: You harness the mystic fortuity of the gold dragon. Whenever you or an ally makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can choose to roll an additional d20. You can take this action after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so after finishing a short or long rest.

subFeatures.name: Sheltering Wings
subFeatures.description: Flexible armor plating grows across your wings, allowing you to use them as shelter for your allies. When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

subFeatures.name: Warrior's Will
subFeatures.description: You adorn your form with a symbol of bravery and prepare yourself to face opposition. You gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

subFeatures.name: Ivory Charge
subFeatures.description: Your horns split into a branching crown of antlers, capable of punching holes through hide and armor alike. You gain an antler natural weapon, which counts as a martial melee weapon for you. You can use it to make melee weapon attacks, with which you are proficient. Your antlers deal piercing damage equal to 3d4 + your Strength modifier. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line during your turn, you gain advantage on the first attack you make with your antlers.

subFeatures.name: Stone Scales
subFeatures.description: You assimilate available minerals in order to create a thick layer of defensive stone scales. Your Armor Class becomes equal to 16 + your Constitution modifier. You are considered as wearing heavy armor, but don't suffer penalties to your Dexterity (Stealth) or as a result of lacking heavy armor proficiency. You lose access to the Flight feature, as well as the speed benefit of Stride.

subFeatures.name: Capable Form
subFeatures.description: Your body grows better suited to grasping and manipulating objects. You can ignore the disadvantage imposed on attack on attack rolls by Mythic Build. Additionally, you gain proficiency with simple and martial weapons as well as with two tools of your choice.

subFeatures.name: Esoteric Ward
subFeatures.description: Runic glyphs carved across your body guard you against a variety of magics. You gain advantage on all Intelligence, Charisma, and Strength saving throws against magical effects.

subFeatures.name: Veiled Wings
subFeatures.description: Your wings expand, elegantly veiling you from your foes. Your Glide & Fly speed increases by 10 ft, and you can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.

subFeatures.name: Reverberating Roar
subFeatures.description: Your voice grows deeper, seeming to come from a much larger creature. As a bonus action, you can roar, inciting fear and hesitation in your enemies. Each creature of your choice within 20 feet of you are forced to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC. A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target can't take reactions until the start of your next turn. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to your roar until the end of your next turn.

subFeatures.name: Tunnel Wyrm
subFeatures.description: You gain a burrowing speed equal to half your walking speed. You can tunnel through loose dirt, gravel, and similar materials, but not through solid materials. If you burrow at half speed, you can reinforce your tunnel as you move, allowing others to pass through-otherwise your tunnel slowly collapses behind you. Additionally, as an action while burrowing near the surface, you can hollow out a portion of space in the terrain, which immediately collapses into a 15-feet wide and deep sinkhole. Creatures caught in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Dragon Spark DC or fall into the sinkhole and drop prone. On a succesful save, a creature can instead choose to move to the nearest available space without provoking opportunity attacks. If you spend 1 minute creating the sinkhole, it will instead collapse when the first creature that is Small or larger moves into its space. You can use this property twice, after which you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subFeatures.name: Blasting Breath
subFeatures.description: Your elemental spark is always at the ready. You can use your action to exhale a bolt of elemental energy and spit it at a creature you can see within a range of 120. Make a ranged Dragon Spark attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 + your dragon spark ability score modifier damage. The damage is the same damage type as your Dragon's Breath. The number of damage dice increases by one at levels 5, 11, and 17.

subFeatures.name: Wyrm Tongue
subFeatures.description: Your suave voice is affable and soothing. You have gain proficiency in Deception or Persuasion (your choice). You can change your choice every time you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, you learn two languages of your choice.

subFeatures.name: Rending Jaws
subFeatures.description: Your jaw muscles grow more powerful, and your fangs grow serrated and cruel, capable of puncturing armor and rending flesh. When you hit with a bite attack, the target suffers a -1 to Armor Class for 1 minute. This effect can only be applied once per creature.

subFeatures.name: White Cunning
subFeatures.description: You instill yourself with the primal awareness of the white dragon. You have advantage on initiative checks and you ignore non-magical difficult terrain.

subFeatures.name: Driving Strikes
subFeatures.description: The tip of your tail develops a tough, bony club, and the force of your blows leaves your enemies reeling. When you make a tail attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal. Additionally, when you hit a target twice on the same turn with any combination of natural weapons, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be pushed 10 feet away from you.

subFeatures.name: Elemental Maw
subFeatures.description: Volatile energy fills your gullet. Once on each of your turns when you hit with a bite attack, you deal an additional 1d6 damage of your Dragon's Breath damage type.

subFeatures.name: Darting Predator
subFeatures.description: You adapt to better surprise your foes with short bursts of speed. You can take the Dash action as a bonus action.

subFeatures.name: Drowning Terror
subFeatures.description: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe both air and water. Whenever you grapple a target that is unable to breathe freely-such as an aquatic creature on land or vice versa-at the start of each of its turns, the target of your grapple must succeed on a Wisdom save against your Dragon Spark DC or become frightened of drowning until it can again breathe freely. Additionally, when you are dragging or carrying a grappled creature with you, your speed is no longer halved.

subFeatures.name: Skewering Quills
subFeatures.description: You develop clusters of sharp quills along your limbs which you can fire in an arc at your foes. You gain a quills natural weapon, which counts as a martial ranged weapon for you and which you are proficient with. You can use them to make ranged weapon attacks with a range of 60/120, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with them. On a hit, they deal 1d10 piercing damage. Hit or miss, one square occupied by the targeted creature is then filled with quills, and you can additionally choose two squares within 5 feet of that square to also fill with quills as your inaccurate bombardment harmlessly scatters across the area. Any creature that subsequently enters a square filled with quills must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save. You can use this attack a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), after which you must finish a short or long rest to use it again.

subFeatures.name: Thorny Spines
subFeatures.description: You grow a series of sharp, slender spikes across your body. Any enemy that deals damage to you in melee suffers 1d4 piercing damage. At the start of each of your turns you deal 1d4 piercing damage to any creature grappling you or any creature grappled by you.

subFeatures.name: Breath of Bolstering Essence
subFeatures.description: Your magical essence is a wellspring of vitality waiting to be shared. As an action, you exhale revitalizing power unto a creature of your choice within 10 feet of you, restoring a number of hit points equal to your demi-dragon level. At your option, you can expend one or more of your Hit Dice, up to half your demi-dragon level. For each Hit Die spent in this way, roll the die then add your Constitution modifier, and add the result to the total amount of hit points you restore to the target. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subFeatures.name: Enthralling Dragonsong
subFeatures.description: You can sing a wordless aria that pacifies your audience. As a bonus action and on each subsequent turn while your song lasts, every creature of your choice within 20 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Dragon Spark or become charmed by you until your song ends. A creature that cannot hear you or which has successfully saved against your song is immune to this use of your song. The song ends after 1 minute, if you are incapacitated, or if you do not maintain it with a bonus action each turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subFeatures.name: Numinous Dragonsong
subFeatures.description: As a bonus action, you can sing a wordless hymn that guides your allies. Your song lasts until the start of your next turn, and while it lasts you and creatures of your choice within 20 feet of you gain a bonus to death saving throws and Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration equal to your dragon spark ability score modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). While singing, you gain blindsight out to 10 feet. If you already have blindsight, it instead increases by 10 feet. The song ends if you are incapacitated or if you do not maintain it with a bonus action each turn.

subFeatures.name: Shape Breath
subFeatures.description: When you breathe destructive energy, you can shape pockets of relative safety within the area of your breath. When you use your Dragon's Breath feature, you can choose a number of creatures that are within the area of the breath weapon and which you can see equal to 1 + your dragon spark ability score modifier (minimum 1). The chosen creatures need not make a saving throw, and take no damage from your Dragon's Breath.

subFeatures.name: Draining Scales
subFeatures.description: You alter your scales to siphon magical energy. Whenever you are a target of any spell of 1st level or higher, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) before the spell's effects are resolved.

subFeatures.name: Silver Mist
subFeatures.description: You take on the aspect of the silver dragon, and can walk on clouds. As a reaction that you can take at any time when you or another creature that is Large or smaller within 60 feet of you falls, you can create a cloud beneath the target as a reaction. The cloud supports the creature's weight and can harmlessly break their fall as if it were a physical object. As part of creating the cloud, you can choose to have it immediately move up to 10 feet up or down, where it will then float in place for up to 1 hour, or until you create a new one.

subFeatures.name: Chameleon Scales
subFeatures.description: Your scales gain the ability to change color, letting you blend in with your surroundings. You can take the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn. You have advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in dim light and in natural terrain, such as rocks, plants, or sand.

subFeatures.name: Venemous Sting
subFeatures.description: Your tail develops a stinger, loaded with poison. Your tail attack deals your choice of piercing or bludgeoning damage. When you deal damage with a tail attack, you can choose to inject the target with poison. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC. On a failure, the target takes an additional 2d6 poison damage and is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

subFeatures.name: Skittering Crawl
subFeatures.description: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. If you move at least 20 feet on the ground or as part of a climb, you can choose to take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

subFeatures.name: Snatching Tail
subFeatures.description: Your tail becomes flexible, letting you unexpectedly catch your foes and yank them around. When you hit a creature that is up to one size category larger than you with your tail, you can choose to force them to roll a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failure, they are pulled to a space of your choosing within 10 feet of you. The space must be on the ground and unoccupied.

traits.description: You harness the mystic fortuity of the gold dragon. Whenever you or an ally makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can choose to roll an additional d20. You can take this action after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so after finishing a short or long rest.

Flexible armor plating grows across your wings, allowing you to use them as shelter for your allies. When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.
You adorn your form with a symbol of bravery and prepare yourself to face opposition. You gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

Your horns split into a branching crown of antlers, capable of punching holes through hide and armor alike. You gain an antler natural weapon, which counts as a martial melee weapon for you. You can use it to make melee weapon attacks, with which you are proficient. Your antlers deal piercing damage equal to 3d4 + your Strength modifier. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line during your turn, you gain advantage on the first attack you make with your antlers.

You assimilate available minerals in order to create a thick layer of defensive stone scales. Your Armor Class becomes equal to 16 + your Constitution modifier. You are considered as wearing heavy armor, but don't suffer penalties to your Dexterity (Stealth) or as a result of lacking heavy armor proficiency. You lose access to the Flight feature, as well as the speed benefit of Stride.

Your body grows better suited to grasping and manipulating objects. You can ignore the disadvantage imposed on attack on attack rolls by Mythic Build. Additionally, you gain proficiency with simple and martial weapons as well as with two tools of your choice.
Runic glyphs carved across your body guard you against a variety of magics. You gain advantage on all Intelligence, Charisma, and Strength saving throws against magical effects.
Your wings expand, elegantly veiling you from your foes. Your Glide & Fly speed increases by 10 ft, and you can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.

Your voice grows deeper, seeming to come from a much larger creature. As a bonus action, you can roar, inciting fear and hesitation in your enemies. Each creature of your choice within 20 feet of you are forced to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC. A target automatically succeeds on the save if it can't hear or see you. On a failed save, a target can't take reactions until the start of your next turn. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to your roar until the end of your next turn.

You gain a burrowing speed equal to half your walking speed. You can tunnel through loose dirt, gravel, and similar materials, but not through solid materials. If you burrow at half speed, you can reinforce your tunnel as you move, allowing others to pass through-otherwise your tunnel slowly collapses behind you. Additionally, as an action while burrowing near the surface, you can hollow out a portion of space in the terrain, which immediately collapses into a 15-feet wide and deep sinkhole. Creatures caught in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Dragon Spark DC or fall into the sinkhole and drop prone. On a succesful save, a creature can instead choose to move to the nearest available space without provoking opportunity attacks. If you spend 1 minute creating the sinkhole, it will instead collapse when the first creature that is Small or larger moves into its space. You can use this property twice, after which you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

Your elemental spark is always at the ready. You can use your action to exhale a bolt of elemental energy and spit it at a creature you can see within a range of 120. Make a ranged Dragon Spark attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 + your dragon spark ability score modifier damage. The damage is the same damage type as your Dragon's Breath. The number of damage dice increases by one at levels 5, 11, and 17.

Your suave voice is affable and soothing. You have gain proficiency in Deception or Persuasion (your choice). You can change your choice every time you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, you learn two languages of your choice.

Your jaw muscles grow more powerful, and your fangs grow serrated and cruel, capable of puncturing armor and rending flesh. When you hit with a bite attack, the target suffers a -1 to Armor Class for 1 minute. This effect can only be applied once per creature.
You instill yourself with the primal awareness of the white dragon. You have advantage on initiative checks and you ignore non-magical difficult terrain.

The tip of your tail develops a tough, bony club, and the force of your blows leaves your enemies reeling. When you make a tail attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal. Additionally, when you hit a target twice on the same turn with any combination of natural weapons, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be pushed 10 feet away from you.
Volatile energy fills your gullet. Once on each of your turns when you hit with a bite attack, you deal an additional 1d6 damage of your Dragon's Breath damage type.
You adapt to better surprise your foes with short bursts of speed. You can take the Dash action as a bonus action.

You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe both air and water. Whenever you grapple a target that is unable to breathe freely-such as an aquatic creature on land or vice versa-at the start of each of its turns, the target of your grapple must succeed on a Wisdom save against your Dragon Spark DC or become frightened of drowning until it can again breathe freely. Additionally, when you are dragging or carrying a grappled creature with you, your speed is no longer halved.

You develop clusters of sharp quills along your limbs which you can fire in an arc at your foes. You gain a quills natural weapon, which counts as a martial ranged weapon for you and which you are proficient with. You can use them to make ranged weapon attacks with a range of 60/120, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with them. On a hit, they deal 1d10 piercing damage. Hit or miss, one square occupied by the targeted creature is then filled with quills, and you can additionally choose two squares within 5 feet of that square to also fill with quills as your inaccurate bombardment harmlessly scatters across the area. Any creature that subsequently enters a square filled with quills must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Dragon Spark save DC or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save. You can use this attack a number of times equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum 1), after which you must finish a short or long rest to use it again.
